title.zh: 卷四 孝和孝殤帝紀
title.en: Volume 4: Annals of Emperor Xiaohe; Emperor Xiaoshang
title.raw: 卷四 孝和孝殤帝紀 Volume 4: Annals of Emperor Xiaohe; Emperor Xiaoshang

sentences.zh: 孝和皇帝諱肇，肅宗第四子也。

translations.literal: Filial and Harmonious Emperor, personal name Zhao, was the fourth son of Emperor Suzong.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor He of Han, whose personal name was Zhao, was the fourth son of Emperor Zhang.

sentences.zh: 母梁貴人，為竇皇后所譖，憂卒，竇后養帝以為己子。

translations.literal: His mother Consort Liang was slandered by Empress Dou, died of worry, Empress Dou raised the Emperor as her own son.
translations.idiomatic: His mother, Consort Liang, was slandered by Empress Dou and died of grief; Empress Dou then raised the Emperor as her own son.

sentences.zh: 建初七年，立為皇太子。

translations.literal: In the seventh year of Jianchu, he was established as Crown Prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year of the Jianchu era (82 CE), he was designated as Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 章和二年二月壬辰，即皇帝位，年十歲。

translations.literal: Zhanghe second year, second month, Renchen day: He ascended the imperial throne at age ten.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renchen day of the second month in the second year of the Zhanghe era (88 CE), he ascended the throne at age ten.

sentences.zh: 尊皇后曰皇太后，太后臨朝。

translations.literal: He honored the Empress as Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager presided over the court.
translations.idiomatic: He honored his mother as Empress Dowager, and she took charge of court affairs.

sentences.zh: 三月丁酉，改淮陽為陳國，楚郡為彭城國，西平幷汝南郡，六安復為廬江郡。

translations.literal: Third month, Dingyou day: He changed Huaiyang to Chen Kingdom, Chu commandery to Pengcheng Kingdom, merged Xiping into Runan commandery, restored Liu'an to Lujiang commandery.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingyou day of the third month, he changed Huaiyang commandery to Chen Kingdom, Chu commandery to Pengcheng Kingdom, merged Xiping into Runan commandery, and restored Liu'an to Lujiang commandery.

sentences.zh: 遺詔徙西平王羨為陳王，六安王恭為彭城王。

translations.literal: Testamentary edict transferred King Xian of Xiping to King of Chen, King Gong of Liu'an to King of Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: By testamentary decree, King Xian of Xiping was transferred to become King of Chen, and King Gong of Liu'an to become King of Pengcheng.

sentences.zh: 癸卯，葬孝章皇帝于敬陵。

translations.literal: Guimao day: He buried Filial Emperor Zhang in the Jing Tomb.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guimao day, Emperor Zhang was buried in the Jing imperial tomb.

sentences.zh: 庚戌，皇太后詔曰：『先帝以明聖，奉承祖宗至德要道，天下清靜，庶事咸寧。

translations.literal: Gengxu day: Empress Dowager's edict said: 'The late Emperor with enlightened sagacity upheld the ancestors' supreme virtue and essential Way, the world was tranquil, all affairs were at peace.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengxu day, the Empress Dowager issued an edict stating: 'The late Emperor, with enlightened wisdom, upheld our ancestors' supreme virtue and essential principles, bringing tranquility to the realm and peace to all matters.'

sentences.zh: 今皇帝以幼年，煢煢在疚，朕且佐助聽政。

translations.literal: Now the Emperor at young age, alone in mourning, I will assist in administering government.
translations.idiomatic: Now the Emperor is young and alone in his mourning, so I will assist in overseeing the administration of government.

sentences.zh: 外有大國賢王並為蕃屏，內有公卿大夫統理本朝，恭己受成，夫何憂哉！

translations.literal: Externally there are great kingdoms' worthy kings serving as protective screens, internally there are dukes, ministers, and grandees managing the ancestral court, reverently accepting accomplishments—what worry is there!
translations.idiomatic: Externally we have the worthy kings of great states serving as protective barriers, internally we have the dukes, ministers, and officials managing the imperial court; by reverently accepting their accomplishments, what cause is there for worry?

sentences.zh: 然守文之際，必有內輔以參聽斷。

translations.literal: Yet during a period of maintaining cultural norms, there must be internal assistance to participate in hearing and deciding.
translations.idiomatic: However, during a time of maintaining established institutions, there must be internal advisors to participate in deliberations and decisions.

sentences.zh: 侍中憲，朕之元兄，行能兼備，忠孝尤篤，先帝所器，親受遺詔，當以舊典輔斯職焉。

translations.literal: Attendant-in-Ordinary Xian, my eldest brother, conduct and ability both complete, loyalty and filial piety especially profound, valued by the late Emperor, personally received the testamentary edict, should by old precedents assist in this office.
translations.idiomatic: Attendant-in-Ordinary Xian, my eldest brother, combines both conduct and ability, with exceptional loyalty and filial piety; he was valued by the late Emperor, personally received the testamentary decree, and should assist in this position according to established precedents.

sentences.zh: 憲固執謙讓，節不可奪。

translations.literal: Xian firmly insisted on declining, his integrity could not be overcome.
translations.idiomatic: Xian steadfastly declined with humility, and his principled resolve could not be shaken.

sentences.zh: 今供養兩宮，宿衛左右，厥事已重，亦不可復勞以政事。

translations.literal: Now attending to both palaces, guarding left and right, those duties are already heavy, also cannot again burden with governmental affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Now he attends to both the imperial palaces, guards the emperor on left and right; those responsibilities are already heavy, and he cannot be further burdened with governmental affairs.

sentences.zh: 故太尉鄧彪，元功之族，三讓彌高，海內歸仁，為群賢首，先帝褒表，欲以崇化。

translations.literal: Former Grand Marshal Deng Biao, clan of primary merit, three declines made him ever higher, the world turned to benevolence, head of the assembled worthies, praised and honored by the late Emperor, wishing to elevate culture.
translations.idiomatic: The former Grand Marshal Deng Biao, from a clan of founding merit, grew ever more exalted through three refusals of office; the realm turned to him in admiration, making him the foremost of all worthy men; the late Emperor praised and honored him, desiring to promote virtuous transformation.

sentences.zh: 今彪聰明康強，可謂老成黃耇矣。

translations.literal: Now Biao is intelligent and robust in health, can be called mature and venerable elder.
translations.idiomatic: Now Biao is intelligent and in vigorous health; he can truly be called a mature and venerable elder.

sentences.zh: 其以彪為太傅，賜爵關內侯，錄尚書事，百官總己以聽，朕庶幾得專心內位。

translations.literal: Let Biao be made Grand Tutor, granted the noble rank of Marquis within the Pass, record the affairs of the Masters of Writing, all officials report to him to listen, I perhaps can concentrate on the inner position.
translations.idiomatic: Let Biao be appointed Grand Tutor, granted the title of Marquis within the Pass, oversee the affairs of the Imperial Secretariat; all officials shall report to him for decisions, so that I may focus my attention on the inner palace.

sentences.zh: 於戲！

translations.literal: Alas!
translations.idiomatic: Alas!

sentences.zh: 群公其勉率百僚，各修厥職，愛養元元，綏以中和，稱朕意焉。』

translations.literal: All the lords should earnestly lead the hundred officials, each cultivate their duties, cherish and nurture the common people, pacify with central harmony, fulfill my intentions.''
translations.idiomatic: All you lords should diligently lead the officials, each attending to their responsibilities, cherishing and nurturing the common people, governing with balanced harmony, and thus fulfill my wishes.''

sentences.zh: 辛酉，有司上奏：『孝章皇帝崇弘鴻業，德化普洽，垂意黎民，留念稼穡。

translations.literal: Xinyou day: The officials submitted a memorial: 'Filial Emperor Zhang exalted and broadened the great enterprise, moral transformation universally pervasive, extended care to the black-haired people, preserved thought for agriculture.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day, the officials submitted a memorial stating: 'The Filial Emperor Zhang exalted and expanded the great imperial enterprise, his moral influence spread universally, he showed concern for the common people, and kept agriculture in mind.'

sentences.zh: 文加殊俗，武暢方表，界惟人面，無思不服。

translations.literal: Culture added to different customs, military extended to distant borders, as far as human faces reached, none who did not submit.
translations.idiomatic: His civilizing influence reached foreign peoples, his military power extended to distant frontiers; wherever human habitation existed, none failed to submit.

sentences.zh: 巍巍蕩蕩，莫與比隆。

translations.literal: Lofty and vast, none can compare in grandeur.
translations.idiomatic: Majestic and boundless, incomparable in glory.

sentences.zh: 《周頌》曰：「於穆清廟，肅雝顯相。」

translations.literal: 'Zhou Eulogies' says: 'Ah, solemn pure temple, reverent and harmonious illustrious assistants.''
translations.idiomatic: The 'Zhou Eulogies' states: 'Ah, solemn is the pure temple, reverent and harmonious are the illustrious assistants.''

sentences.zh: 請上尊廟曰肅宗，共進《武德》之舞。』

translations.literal: Request to honor the temple as Emperor Suzong, together present the 'Martial Virtue' dance.''
translations.idiomatic: We request to honor his temple as Emperor Suzong and together perform the 'Martial Virtue' dance.''

sentences.zh: 制曰：『可。』

translations.literal: Imperial decree said: 'Approved.''
translations.idiomatic: An imperial decree stated: 'Approved.''

sentences.zh: 癸亥，陳王羨、彭城王恭、樂成王黨、下邳王衍、梁王暢始就國。

translations.literal: Guihai day: King Xian of Chen, King Gong of Pengcheng, King Dang of Yuecheng, King Yan of Xiapi, King Chang of Liang first proceeded to their kingdoms.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guihai day, King Xian of Chen, King Gong of Pengcheng, King Dang of Yuecheng, King Yan of Xiapi, and King Chang of Liang first took up residence in their respective kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙子，謁高廟。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Bingzi day: He paid respects at the High Temple.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingzi day of the fourth month of summer, he paid respects at the High Temple.

sentences.zh: 丁丑，謁世祖廟。

translations.literal: Dingchou day: He paid respects at the Shizu Temple.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day, he paid respects at the Temple of Emperor Guangwu.

sentences.zh: 戊寅，詔曰：『昔孝武皇帝致誅胡、越，故權收鹽鐵之利，以奉師旅之費。

translations.literal: Wuyin day: Imperial edict said: 'Formerly Filial Emperor Wu executed campaigns against the Hu and Yue, therefore temporarily collected the profits from salt and iron, to supply the expenses of the armies.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuyin day, an imperial edict stated: 'In former times, Emperor Wu waged campaigns against the Xiongnu and Yue peoples, and therefore temporarily monopolized the profits from salt and iron to fund military expenditures.'

sentences.zh: 自中興以來，匈奴未賓，永平末年，復修征伐。

translations.literal: Since the Restoration, the Xiongnu have not submitted, at the end of Yongping years, again prepared campaigns.
translations.idiomatic: Since the dynasty's restoration, the Xiongnu had not submitted; at the end of the Yongping era, campaigns were again undertaken against them.

sentences.zh: 先帝即位，務休力役，然猶深思遠慮，安不忘危，探觀舊典，復收鹽鐵，欲以防備不虞，寧安邊境。

translations.literal: The late Emperor upon ascending the throne, diligently rested the corvee labor, yet still deeply pondered far-reaching concerns, at peace but not forgetting danger, investigated and viewed the old canons, again collected salt and iron, desiring to prepare for the unexpected, pacify and secure the border regions.
translations.idiomatic: When the late Emperor ascended the throne, he diligently allowed the people to rest from corvee labor, yet he still pondered deeply and planned carefully, remaining at peace but vigilant against danger; he examined the ancient institutions and once again monopolized salt and iron production, desiring to prepare for unforeseen circumstances and secure the frontier regions.

sentences.zh: 而吏多不良，動失其便，以違上意。

translations.literal: Yet officials were mostly not good, often lost the advantage, thus contravening the imperial will.
translations.idiomatic: However, most officials were incompetent and frequently mishandled matters to their detriment, thereby going against the emperor's intentions.

sentences.zh: 先帝恨之，故遺戒郡國罷鹽鐵之禁，縱民煮鑄，入稅縣官如故事。

translations.literal: The late Emperor resented it, therefore left instructions to commanderies and kingdoms to abolish the salt and iron prohibitions, allow the people to boil and cast, pay taxes to the county officials as in former practice.
translations.idiomatic: The late Emperor was displeased by this and therefore left instructions for the commanderies and kingdoms to abolish the salt and iron monopolies, allowing the people to freely produce salt and iron and pay taxes to the government as had been done previously.

sentences.zh: 其申勑刺史、二千石，奉順聖旨，勉弘德化，布告天下，使明知朕意。』

translations.literal: Let them earnestly exhort the inspectors and two thousand shi officials, follow and obey the sacred decrees, diligently expand moral transformation, proclaim to the world, cause them to clearly know my intentions.''
translations.idiomatic: Let them earnestly instruct the inspectors and officials of two thousand shi rank to follow and obey the imperial decrees, diligently promote virtuous transformation, and proclaim this throughout the realm so that my intentions are clearly understood.''

sentences.zh: 五月，京師旱。

translations.literal: Fifth month: The capital suffered drought.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, the capital region experienced drought.

sentences.zh: 詔長樂少府桓郁侍講禁中。

translations.literal: Imperial edict ordered Chamberlain for the Palace Revenues Huan Yu to serve as lecturer in the inner palace.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, Huan Yu, Chamberlain for the Palace Revenues, was ordered to serve as lecturer in the imperial residence.

sentences.zh: 冬十月乙亥，以侍中竇憲為車騎將軍，伐北匈奴。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Yihai day: Appointed Attendant-in-Ordinary Dou Xian as Cavalry General, to campaign against the Northern Xiongnu.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yihai day of the tenth month of winter, Dou Xian was appointed Cavalry General to lead a campaign against the Northern Xiongnu.

sentences.zh: 安息國遣使獻師子、扶拔。

translations.literal: The kingdom of Anxi dispatched envoys to present lions and elephants.
translations.idiomatic: The Parthian kingdom sent envoys to present lions and elephants as tribute.

sentences.zh: 永元元年春三月甲辰，初令郎官詔除者得占丞、尉，以比秩為真。

translations.literal: Yongyuan first year, spring, third month, Jiachen day: For the first time ordered that court gentlemen dismissed by edict may occupy the positions of assistant and captain, treating probationary rank as permanent.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiachen day of the third month of spring in the first year of Yongyuan, it was decreed for the first time that court gentlemen dismissed by imperial edict could take up the positions of assistant magistrate and captain, with their probationary ranks becoming permanent.

sentences.zh: 夏六月，車騎將軍竇憲出雞鹿塞，度遼將軍鄧鴻出稒陽塞，南單于出滿夷谷，與北匈奴戰於稽落山，大破之，追至私渠比鞮海。

translations.literal: Summer, sixth month: Cavalry General Dou Xian went out through Jilu Pass, General of Liaodong Deng Hong went out through Zuyang Pass, Southern Chanyu went out through Manli Valley, battled the Northern Xiongnu at Jiluo Mountain, greatly defeated them, pursued to Siqiu Bidihai.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month of summer, Cavalry General Dou Xian advanced through the Jilu Pass, General of Liaodong Deng Hong through the Zuyang Pass, and the Southern Chanyu through the Manli Valley; they fought the Northern Xiongnu at Jiluo Mountain, inflicted a major defeat, and pursued them as far as the Siqiu Bidihai.

sentences.zh: 竇憲遂登燕然山，刻石勒功而還。

translations.literal: Dou Xian then ascended Yanran Mountain, carved stone to record the achievements and returned.
translations.idiomatic: Dou Xian then climbed Mount Yanran, had a stone inscription carved to record the victory, and returned.

sentences.zh: 北單于遣弟右溫禺鞮王奉奏貢獻。

translations.literal: The Northern Chanyu sent his younger brother Right Wen Yurdi Wang to present a memorial and tribute.
translations.idiomatic: The Northern Chanyu sent his younger brother, the Right Wen Yurdi Wang, to present a memorial and offer tribute.

sentences.zh: 秋七月乙未，會稽山崩。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Yiyou day: Mount Kuaiji collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day of the seventh month of autumn, Mount Kuaiji suffered a landslide.

sentences.zh: 閏月丙子，詔曰：『匈奴背叛，為害久遠。

translations.literal: Intercalary month, Bingzi day: Imperial edict said: 'The Xiongnu have turned their backs and rebelled, causing harm for a long time.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingzi day of the intercalary month, an imperial edict stated: 'The Xiongnu have betrayed their allegiance and caused harm for many years.'

sentences.zh: 賴祖宗之靈，師克有捷，醜虜破碎，遂掃厥庭，役不再籍，萬里清蕩，非朕小子眇身所能克堪。

translations.literal: Relying on the spirits of the ancestors, the army achieved victory, the vile captives were smashed, thus sweeping their court, conscription not repeated, ten thousand li cleared and cleansed, not something my young and insignificant person could accomplish.'
translations.idiomatic: Thanks to the blessings of our ancestors, the army achieved victory, the vile barbarians were utterly defeated, their very hearths swept clean; military conscription need not be repeated, and the realm for ten thousand li is now pacified—this is beyond what my unworthy person could have accomplished.'

sentences.zh: 有司其案舊典，告類薦功，以章休烈。』

translations.literal: Officials should examine the old canons, announce to the ancestral spirits and recommend merits, to manifest the auspicious achievements.''
translations.idiomatic: The officials should consult the ancient precedents, make announcements to the ancestral spirits and commend the meritorious, to proclaim these glorious accomplishments.''

sentences.zh: 九月庚申，以車騎將軍竇憲為大將軍，以中郎將劉尚為車騎將軍。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Gengshen day: Appointed Cavalry General Dou Xian as Grand General, appointed Colonel Liu Shang as Cavalry General.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengshen day of the ninth month, Dou Xian was appointed Grand General, and Liu Shang was appointed Cavalry General.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，令郡國刑輸作軍營，其徙出塞者，刑雖未竟，皆免歸田里。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Ordered commanderies and kingdoms to send convicts to labor in military camps, those exiled beyond the frontier, even if their sentences were not completed, all pardoned and allowed to return to their villages.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, he ordered the commanderies and kingdoms to send convicts to work in military camps; even those exiled beyond the frontier whose sentences were incomplete were all pardoned and permitted to return to their home villages.

sentences.zh: 庚子，阜陵王延薨。

translations.literal: Gengzi day: King Yan of Fuling passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day, King Yan of Fuling died.

sentences.zh: 是歲，郡國九大水。

translations.literal: This year, nine commanderies and kingdoms experienced major flooding.
translations.idiomatic: This year, nine commanderies and kingdoms suffered severe flooding.

sentences.zh: 二年春正月丁丑，大赦天下。

translations.literal: Second year, spring, first month, Dingchou day: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day of the first month of spring in the second year, a general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 二月壬午，日有食之。

translations.literal: Second month, Renwu day: There was a solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renwu day of the second month, there was an eclipse of the sun.

sentences.zh: 己亥，復置西河、上郡屬國都尉官。

translations.literal: Jihai day: Again established the offices of Commandant of the Dependent State for Xihe and Shangjun.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jihai day, the offices of Commandant of the Dependent State were reestablished for Xihe and Shangjun commanderies.

sentences.zh: 夏五月庚戌，分太山為濟北國，分樂成、涿郡、勃海為河間國。

translations.literal: Summer, fifth month, Gengxu day: Divided Taishan to form Jibei Kingdom, divided Yuecheng, Zhuojun, and Bohai to form Hejian Kingdom.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengxu day of the fifth month of summer, Taishan commandery was divided to form Jibei Kingdom, and Yuecheng, Zhuojun, and Bohai were divided to form Hejian Kingdom.

sentences.zh: 丙辰，封皇弟壽為濟北王，開為河間王，淑為城陽王，紹封故淮陽王昞子側為常山王。

translations.literal: Bingchen day: Enfeoffed imperial younger brother Shou as King of Jibei, Kai as King of Hejian, Shu as King of Chengyang, continued enfeoffment of Ce, son of the former King Biao of Huaiyang, as King of Changshan.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day, his younger brothers were enfeoffed: Shou as King of Jibei, Kai as King of Hejian, and Shu as King of Chengyang; and Ce, son of the former King Biao of Huaiyang, was granted continued enfeoffment as King of Changshan.

sentences.zh: 賜公卿以下至佐史錢、布各有差。

translations.literal: Granted money and cloth to dukes, ministers, and below down to assistants and scribes, each according to their rank.
translations.idiomatic: He bestowed money and cloth upon the dukes and ministers and below, down to the assistants and scribes, each according to their position.

sentences.zh: 己未，遣副校尉閻磐討北匈奴，取伊吾盧地。

translations.literal: Jiwei day: Dispatched Vice Colonel Yan Pan to campaign against the Northern Xiongnu, took the Yiwu fortress territory.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiwei day, Vice Colonel Yan Pan was dispatched to campaign against the Northern Xiongnu and captured the fortress territory of Yiwu.

sentences.zh: 丁卯，紹封故齊王晃子無忌為齊王，北海王睦子威為北海王。

translations.literal: Dingmao day: Continued enfeoffment of Wuji, son of the former King Huang of Qi, as King of Qi, Wei, son of King Mu of Beihai, as King of Beihai.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day, Wuji, son of the former King Huang of Qi, was granted continued enfeoffment as King of Qi, and Wei, son of King Mu of Beihai, as King of Beihai.

sentences.zh: 車師前後王並遣子入侍。

translations.literal: The Cheshi Front and Rear Kings both sent their sons to enter service.
translations.idiomatic: Both the Front King and Rear King of Cheshi sent their sons to serve at court.

sentences.zh: 月氏國遣兵攻西域長史班超，超擊降之。

translations.literal: The kingdom of Yuezhi dispatched troops to attack the Western Regions Grand Administrator Ban Chao, Chao attacked and defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: The Yuezhi kingdom sent troops to attack Grand Administrator Ban Chao of the Western Regions, but Ban Chao attacked and subdued them.

sentences.zh: 六月辛卯，中山王焉薨。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Xinmao day: King Yan of Zhongshan passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the sixth month, King Yan of Zhongshan died.

sentences.zh: 秋七月乙卯，大將軍竇憲出屯涼州。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Yimao day: Grand General Dou Xian went out to garrison Liangzhou.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yimao day of the seventh month of autumn, Grand General Dou Xian went out to station troops in Liangzhou.

sentences.zh: 九月，北匈奴遣使稱臣。

translations.literal: Ninth month: The Northern Xiongnu dispatched envoys to profess vassalage.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, the Northern Xiongnu sent envoys to declare themselves subjects.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，遣行中郎將班固報命南單于。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Dispatched Acting Colonel Ban Gu to convey the imperial mandate to the Southern Chanyu.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, Acting Colonel Ban Gu was dispatched to deliver the imperial decree to the Southern Chanyu.

sentences.zh: 遣左谷蠡王師子出雞鹿塞，擊北匈奴於河雲北，大破之。

translations.literal: Dispatched Left Guli King Shi Zi to go out through Jilu Pass, attacked the Northern Xiongnu north of Heyun, greatly defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: The Left Guli King Shi Zi was dispatched through the Jilu Pass to attack the Northern Xiongnu north of Heyun, where he inflicted a major defeat upon them.

sentences.zh: 三年春正月甲子，皇帝加元服，賜諸侯王、公、將軍、特進、中二千石、列侯、宗室子孫在京師奉朝請者黃金，將、大夫、郎吏、從官帛。

translations.literal: Third year, spring, first month, Jiazi day: The Emperor assumed the cap of manhood, granted gold to regional kings, dukes, generals, senior retainers, middle two thousand shi, marquises, and imperial clansmen descendants in the capital who presented at court; granted silk to commanders, grandees, court gentlemen officials, and attendant officials.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day of the first month of spring in the third year, the Emperor came of age and assumed the cap of manhood; he granted gold to the regional kings, dukes, generals, senior retainers, officials of middle two thousand shi rank, marquises, and imperial clansmen in the capital who attended court; and silk to commanders, grandees, court gentlemen, and attendant officials.

sentences.zh: 賜民爵及粟帛各有差，大酺五日。

translations.literal: Granted noble ranks and grain and silk to the people each according to their status, great feast for five days.
translations.idiomatic: The common people were granted noble ranks and varying amounts of grain and silk according to their status, and a grand festival was held for five days.

sentences.zh: 郡國中都官繫囚死罪贖縑，至司寇及亡命，各有差。

translations.literal: Commandery and kingdom central offices' imprisoned convicts with death sentences redeemed with silk, down to prison guards and fugitives, each according to their circumstances.
translations.idiomatic: Prisoners in commandery and kingdom central offices sentenced to death could redeem their sentences with silk; the same applied to those sentenced to prison guard duty and fugitives, each according to their specific circumstances.

sentences.zh: 庚辰，賜京師民酺，布兩戶共一匹。

translations.literal: Gengchen day: Granted feast to the capital people, cloth shared by two households one bolt.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengchen day, the people of the capital were granted a festival, with one bolt of cloth shared between two households.

sentences.zh: 二月，大將軍竇憲遣左校尉耿夔出居延塞，圍北單于於金微山，大破之，獲其母閼氏。

translations.literal: Second month: Grand General Dou Xian dispatched Left Colonel Geng Kui to go out through the Juyan Pass, surrounded the Northern Chanyu at Jinwei Mountain, greatly defeated him, captured his mother the Yanzhi.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, Grand General Dou Xian sent Left Colonel Geng Kui through the Juyan Pass to surround the Northern Chanyu at Jinwei Mountain, where he inflicted a major defeat and captured the Chanyu's mother, the Yanzhi.

sentences.zh: 夏六月辛卯，尊皇太後母比陽公主為長公主。

translations.literal: Summer, sixth month, Xinmao day: Honored the Empress Dowager's mother Princess Biyang as Grand Princess.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the sixth month of summer, the Empress Dowager's mother, Princess Biyang, was honored as Grand Princess.

sentences.zh: 辛丑，阜陵王種薨。

translations.literal: Xinchou day: King Zhong of Fuling passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinchou day, King Zhong of Fuling died.

sentences.zh: 冬十月癸未，行幸長安。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Guiwei day: Made a progress to Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiwei day of the tenth month of winter, he made an imperial journey to Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『北狄破滅，名王仍降，西域諸國，納質內附，豈非祖宗迪哲重光之鴻烈歟？

translations.literal: Imperial edict said: 'The Northern barbarians have been destroyed, famous kings repeatedly surrender, Western Regions various kingdoms present hostages and submit internally, could this not be the great achievement of our ancestors' enlightened wisdom and renewed brilliance?
translations.idiomatic: An imperial edict stated: 'The northern barbarians have been utterly destroyed, renowned kings have repeatedly surrendered, the various kingdoms of the Western Regions have submitted hostages and joined us—could this not be the magnificent achievement of our ancestors' enlightened wisdom and restored glory?'

sentences.zh: 寤寐嘆息，想望舊京。

translations.literal: Awake and asleep sighing, longing for the old capital.'
translations.idiomatic: Constantly sighing whether awake or asleep, longing for the former capital.'

sentences.zh: 其賜行所過二千石長吏已下及三老、官屬錢帛，各有差；

translations.literal: Grant money and silk to the two thousand shi senior officials and below that the procession passes, as well as the Three Elders and officials, each according to their rank;
translations.idiomatic: Grant money and silk to the senior officials of two thousand shi rank and below along the route of the procession, as well as to the Three Elders and other officials, each according to their position;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃、貧不能自存者粟，人三斛。』

translations.literal: Widowers, widows, orphans, the solitary, the severely ill, and the poor who cannot support themselves: grain, each three dou.''
translations.idiomatic: Widowers, widows, orphans, the childless elderly, the gravely ill, and the impoverished who cannot sustain themselves shall each receive three dou of grain.''

sentences.zh: 十一月癸卯，祠高廟，遂有事十一陵。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Guimao day: Sacrificed at the High Temple, then conducted ceremonies at the eleven imperial tombs.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guimao day of the eleventh month, he performed sacrifices at the High Temple and then conducted ceremonies at the eleven imperial tombs.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『高祖功臣，蕭、曹為首，有傳世不絕之義。

translations.literal: Imperial edict said: 'Gaozu's meritorious officials, Xiao and Cao were the foremost, there is the principle of inheritance that should not be cut off.
translations.idiomatic: An imperial edict stated: 'Among Gaozu's meritorious officials, Xiao and Cao were the most prominent, and there is the principle that their lines of inheritance should continue unbroken.

sentences.zh: 曹相國後容城侯無嗣。

translations.literal: The Marquis of Rongcheng, descendant of Chancellor Cao, has no heir.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Rongcheng, who is a descendant of Chancellor Cao, has no heir.

sentences.zh: 朕望長陵東門，見二臣之壠，循其遠節，每有感焉。

translations.literal: I gaze at the east gate of Changling, see the tombs of these two ministers, follow their distant integrity, always moved thereby.
translations.idiomatic: When I gaze at the east gate of Changling and see the tombs of these two ministers, I am always moved by their exemplary integrity from long ago.

sentences.zh: 忠義獲寵，古今所同。

translations.literal: Loyalty and righteousness obtaining favor, is the same in ancient and modern times.
translations.idiomatic: Loyalty and righteousness receiving favor is a principle that has remained the same from ancient times to the present.

sentences.zh: 可遣使者以中牢祠，大鴻臚求近親宜為嗣者，須景風紹封，以章厥功。』

translations.literal: May dispatch envoys to sacrifice with the middle sacrificial animals, Grand Herald to seek close relatives suitable to be heirs, await the gentle breeze to continue the enfeoffment, to proclaim their achievements.''
translations.idiomatic: Envoys should be dispatched to perform sacrifices with the middle sacrificial animals, and the Grand Herald should seek suitable close relatives to serve as heirs; when favorable conditions arise, continue the enfeoffment to proclaim their meritorious deeds.''

sentences.zh: 十二月，復置西域都護、騎都尉、戊己校尉官。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: Again established the offices of Western Regions Protector General, Cavalry Colonel, and Wu-Ji Colonels.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, the offices of Protector General of the Western Regions, Cavalry Colonel, and Wu-Ji Colonels were reestablished.

sentences.zh: 庚辰，至自長安，減刑徒從駕者刑五月。

translations.literal: Gengchen day: Arrived from Chang'an, reduced the sentences of convicts who accompanied the imperial carriage by five months.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengchen day, upon returning from Chang'an, the sentences of convicts who accompanied the imperial procession were reduced by five months.

sentences.zh: 四年春正月，北匈奴右谷蠡王於除鞬自立為單于，款塞乞降。

translations.literal: Fourth year, spring, first month: The Northern Xiongnu Right Guli King Yu Chujian established himself as Chanyu, knocked on the frontier and begged to surrender.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the fourth year, the Right Guli King Yu Chujian of the Northern Xiongnu proclaimed himself Chanyu and came to the frontier begging to submit.

sentences.zh: 遣大將軍左校尉耿夔授璽綬。

translations.literal: Dispatched Grand General Left Colonel Geng Kui to confer the seal and tassels.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand General's Left Colonel Geng Kui was dispatched to confer the imperial seal and tassels.

sentences.zh: 三月癸丑，司徒袁安薨。

translations.literal: Third month, Guiyou day: Minister of the Masses Yuan An passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day of the third month, Minister of the Masses Yuan An died.

sentences.zh: 閏月丁丑，太常丁鴻為司徒。

translations.literal: Intercalary month, Dingchou day: Grand Herald Ding Hong became Minister of the Masses.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day of the intercalary month, Ding Hong, the Grand Herald, was appointed Minister of the Masses.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙辰，大將軍竇憲還至京師。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Bingchen day: Grand General Dou Xian returned to the capital.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day of the fourth month of summer, Grand General Dou Xian returned to the capital.

sentences.zh: 六月戊戌朔，日有食之。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Wuxu day, first day of the month: There was a solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the first day of the sixth month, the Wuxu day, there was an eclipse of the sun.

sentences.zh: 丙辰，郡國十三地震。

translations.literal: Bingchen day: Thirteen commanderies and kingdoms experienced earthquakes.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day, thirteen commanderies and kingdoms suffered earthquakes.

sentences.zh: 竇憲潛圖弒逆。

translations.literal: Dou Xian secretly plotted regicide and rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: Dou Xian secretly plotted to assassinate the emperor and rebel.

sentences.zh: 庚申，幸北宮。

translations.literal: Gengshen day: Made a progress to the Northern Palace.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengshen day, he made a visit to the Northern Palace.

sentences.zh: 詔收捕憲黨射聲校尉郭璜，璜子侍中舉，衛尉鄧疊，疊弟步兵校尉磊。

translations.literal: Imperial edict ordered the arrest of Dou Xian's partisans: Colonel of the Archers Guo Huang, Huang's son Attendant-in-Ordinary Ju, Commander of the Guards Deng Die, Die's younger brother Infantry Colonel Lei.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, Dou Xian's confederates were ordered arrested: Colonel of the Archers Guo Huang, Huang's son Attendant-in-Ordinary Ju, Commander of the Guards Deng Die, and Die's younger brother Infantry Colonel Lei.

sentences.zh: 皆下獄死。

translations.literal: All were imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: All were imprisoned and executed.

sentences.zh: 使謁者僕射收憲大將軍印綬，遣憲及弟篤、景就國，到皆自殺。

translations.literal: Ordered the Palace Attendant Commander to seize Dou Xian's Grand General seal and tassels, sent Dou Xian and his younger brothers Du and Jing to their kingdoms, upon arrival all committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: The Palace Attendant Commander was ordered to confiscate Dou Xian's Grand General seal and tassels; Dou Xian and his younger brothers Du and Jing were sent to their kingdoms, where they all committed suicide upon arrival.

sentences.zh: 是夏、旱、蝗。

translations.literal: This summer: drought and locusts.
translations.idiomatic: This summer brought drought and locust infestations.

sentences.zh: 秋七月己丑，太尉宋由坐黨憲自殺。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Jichou day: Grand Marshal Song You, because of being allied with Dou Xian, committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jichou day of the seventh month of autumn, Grand Marshal Song You committed suicide for his association with Dou Xian.

sentences.zh: 八月辛亥，司空任隗薨。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Xinhai day: Minister of Works Ren Kui passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinhai day of the eighth month, Minister of Works Ren Kui died.

sentences.zh: 癸丑，大司農尹睦為太尉，錄尚書事。

translations.literal: Guiyou day: Grand Minister of Agriculture Yin Mu became Grand Marshal, overseeing the affairs of the Masters of Writing.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day, Yin Mu, the Grand Minister of Agriculture, was appointed Grand Marshal and put in charge of the Imperial Secretariat.

sentences.zh: 丁巳，賜公卿以下至佐史錢、穀各有差。

translations.literal: Dingsi day: Granted money and grain to the dukes and ministers and below down to the assistants and scribes, each according to their rank.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingsi day, money and grain were granted to the dukes and ministers and below, down to the assistants and scribes, each according to their position.

sentences.zh: 冬十月己亥，宗正劉方為司空。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Jihai day: Director of the Imperial Clan Liu Fang became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jihai day of the tenth month of winter, Liu Fang, the Director of the Imperial Clan, was appointed Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 十二月壬辰，詔：『今年郡國秋稼為旱、蝗所傷，其什四以上勿收田租、芻稾；

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Renchen day: Imperial edict: 'This year the autumn harvests of the commanderies and kingdoms have been injured by drought and locusts, those exceeding four-tenths shall not collect land taxes and fodder;
translations.idiomatic: On the Renchen day of the twelfth month, an imperial edict stated: 'This year the autumn crops of the commanderies and kingdoms have been damaged by drought and locusts; for those areas where the damage exceeds 40%, land taxes and fodder shall not be collected;'

sentences.zh: 有不滿者，以實除之。』

translations.literal: Those who do not reach the amount, remove them based on actual conditions.''
translations.idiomatic: For those who do not meet the requirements, remove them according to the actual circumstances.''

sentences.zh: 武陵零陵澧中蠻叛。

translations.literal: The barbarians of Wuling, Lingling, and the Li River region rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: The barbarians in Wuling commandery, Lingling commandery, and the Li River area rebelled.

sentences.zh: 燒當羌寇金城。

translations.literal: The Shaodang Qiang raided Jincheng.
translations.idiomatic: The Shaodang Qiang tribe raided Jincheng commandery.

sentences.zh: 五年春正月乙亥，宗祀五帝於明堂，遂登靈臺，望雲物。

translations.literal: Fifth year, spring, first month, Yihai day: Ancestral sacrifices to the Five Emperors in the Bright Hall, then ascended the Spirit Platform to observe the cloud formations.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yihai day of the first month of spring in the fifth year, ancestral sacrifices were performed to the Five Emperors in the Bright Hall, after which he ascended the Spirit Platform to observe the cloud formations.

sentences.zh: 大赦天下。

translations.literal: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: A general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 戊子，千乘王伉薨。

translations.literal: Wuzi day: King Kang of Qiancheng passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuzi day, King Kang of Qiancheng died.

sentences.zh: 辛卯，封皇帝萬歲為廣宗王。

translations.literal: Xinmao day: Enfeoffed the Emperor's Wan Sui as King of Guangzong.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day, the emperor's Wan Sui was enfeoffed as King of Guangzong.

sentences.zh: 二月戊戌，詔有司省減內外廄及涼州諸苑馬。

translations.literal: Second month, Wuxu day: Imperial edict ordered the officials to reduce the inner and outer stables and the horses in the various parks of Liangzhou.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuxu day of the second month, an imperial edict ordered the officials to reduce the numbers of horses in the inner and outer imperial stables and the various parks of Liangzhou.

sentences.zh: 自京師離宮果園上林廣成囿悉以假貧民，恣得采捕，不收其稅。

translations.literal: The detached palaces, orchards, and Shanglin Guangcheng parks in the capital were all loaned to poor people, they could freely gather and hunt, taxes were not collected from them.
translations.idiomatic: All the detached palaces, orchards, and the Shanglin and Guangcheng parks in the capital were loaned to the poor, allowing them to freely gather and hunt without collecting taxes.

sentences.zh: 丁未，詔曰：『去年秋麥入少，恐民食不足。

translations.literal: Dingwei day: Imperial edict said: 'Last year's autumn wheat harvest was small, fearing that the people's food is insufficient.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingwei day, an imperial edict stated: 'Last year's autumn wheat harvest was meager, and I fear the people may not have enough food.'

sentences.zh: 其上尤貧不能自給者戶口人數。

translations.literal: Let them submit the household and population numbers of those who are especially poor and cannot support themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Let them report the numbers of households and people who are particularly impoverished and cannot support themselves.

sentences.zh: 往者郡國上貧民，以衣履釜鬵為貲，而豪右得其饒利。

translations.literal: Formerly when commanderies and kingdoms reported poor people, using clothing, shoes, pots, and pans as capital, yet the powerful and wealthy obtained their abundant profits.
translations.idiomatic: In the past, when commanderies and kingdoms reported on the poor, using clothing, shoes, pots, and pans as the criteria, the powerful and wealthy elites still profited handsomely from the situation.

sentences.zh: 詔書實覈，欲有以益之，而長吏不能躬親，反更徵召會聚，令失農作，愁擾百姓。

translations.literal: The edict wanted genuine investigation to benefit them, yet the senior officials could not personally attend, instead further summoned and assembled them, causing them to lose farm work and distressing and troubling the common people.
translations.idiomatic: The edict called for genuine investigation to provide benefits, but the senior officials could not personally oversee this; instead, they further summoned and gathered the people, causing them to neglect farming and distressing the common people.

sentences.zh: 若復有犯者，二千石先坐。』

translations.literal: If there are further violations, the two thousand shi officials shall be held responsible first.''
translations.idiomatic: If there are further violations, the officials of two thousand shi rank shall be held primarily responsible.''

sentences.zh: 甲寅，太傅鄧彪薨。

translations.literal: Jiazi day: Grand Tutor Deng Biao passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day, Grand Tutor Deng Biao died.

sentences.zh: 戊午，隴西地震。

translations.literal: Wuwu day: Longxi experienced an earthquake.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuwu day, Longxi commandery suffered an earthquake.

sentences.zh: 三月戊子，詔曰：『選舉良才，為政之本。

translations.literal: Third month, Wuzi day: Imperial edict said: 'Selecting worthy talents is the foundation of governance.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuzi day of the third month, an imperial edict stated: 'Selecting worthy talents is the foundation of good governance.'

sentences.zh: 科別行能，必由鄉曲。

translations.literal: Categorizing conduct and ability must come from the villages and hamlets.
translations.idiomatic: Assessing conduct and ability must begin at the local village level.

sentences.zh: 而郡國舉吏，不加簡擇，故先帝明勑在所，令試之以職，乃得充選。

translations.literal: Yet commanderies and kingdoms recommend officials without careful selection, therefore the late Emperor's clear instructions to the localities ordered them to test with office, only then could they fill the selections.
translations.idiomatic: However, commanderies and kingdoms recommend officials without proper scrutiny, so the late Emperor's clear instructions to local authorities required them to test candidates in office before they could be selected.

sentences.zh: 又德行尤異，不須經職者，別署狀上。

translations.literal: Moreover, those whose virtue and conduct are exceptionally outstanding, who do not need to undergo office testing, separately sign and submit their records.
translations.idiomatic: Furthermore, those whose moral character and conduct are exceptionally outstanding, who do not need to undergo office testing, should have their records specially signed and submitted.

sentences.zh: 而宣布以來，出入九年，二千石曾不承奉，恣心從好，司隸、刺史訖無糾察。

translations.literal: Yet since the edict was announced, nine years have passed, the two thousand shi have never complied, indulging their hearts in favoritism, the Commandant of the Capital Region and inspectors have never investigated or corrected.
translations.idiomatic: However, since the edict was announced, nine years have passed, and the officials of two thousand shi rank have never complied; they indulge in favoritism, and neither the Commandant of the Capital Region nor the inspectors have ever investigated or corrected this.

sentences.zh: 今新蒙赦令，且復申勑，後有犯者，顯明其罰。

translations.literal: Now newly receiving the amnesty edict, I will again issue clear instructions; those who violate afterward, make their punishments clear.
translations.idiomatic: Now that we have newly received the amnesty edict, I will again issue clear instructions; for those who violate afterward, their punishments shall be clearly stated.

sentences.zh: 在位不以選舉為憂，督察不以發覺為負，非獨州郡也。

translations.literal: Those in office do not worry about selections, supervisors do not consider detection as their duty, it is not only the provinces and commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: Those in office do not worry about proper selections, supervisors do not consider detection of misconduct their responsibility—this is not limited to the provinces and commanderies.

sentences.zh: 是以庶官多非其人。

translations.literal: Therefore the various officials are mostly not the right people.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore most officials are not suitable for their positions.

sentences.zh: 下民被姦邪之傷，由法不行故也。』

translations.literal: The common people suffer injury from wicked evil, because the laws are not implemented.''
translations.idiomatic: The common people suffer harm from corrupt and evil influences because the laws are not being enforced.''

sentences.zh: 庚寅，遣使者分行貧民，舉實流冗，開倉賑稟三十餘郡。

translations.literal: Gengyin day: Dispatched envoys to separately inspect the poor people, report actual vagrants and redundant officials, opened granaries to provide relief to more than thirty commanderies.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengyin day, envoys were dispatched to separately inspect the poor, report on actual vagrants and redundant officials, and opened granaries to provide relief to more than thirty commanderies.

sentences.zh: 夏四月壬子，封阜陵王种兄魴為阜陵王。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Renzi day: Enfeoffed King Zhong of Fuling's elder brother Fang as King of Fuling.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renzi day of the fourth month of summer, King Zhong of Fuling's elder brother Fang was enfeoffed as King of Fuling.

sentences.zh: 六月丁酉，郡國三雨雹。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Dingyou day: Three commanderies and kingdoms experienced hailstorms.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingyou day of the sixth month, three commanderies and kingdoms suffered hailstorms.

sentences.zh: 秋九月辛酉，廣宗王萬歲薨，無子，國除。

translations.literal: Autumn, ninth month, Xinyou day: King Wansui of Guangzong passed away, had no son, kingdom abolished.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day of the ninth month of autumn, King Wansui of Guangzong died without a son, and his kingdom was abolished.

sentences.zh: 匈奴單于於除鞬叛，遣中朗將任尚討滅之。

translations.literal: The Xiongnu Chanyu Yu Chujian rebelled, dispatched Colonel Zhonglang Ren Shang to campaign and destroy him.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu Chanyu Yu Chujian rebelled, so Colonel Zhonglang Ren Shang was dispatched to campaign against and destroy him.

sentences.zh: 壬午，令郡縣勸民蓄蔬食以助五谷。

translations.literal: Renwu day: Ordered commanderies and counties to encourage the people to store vegetables and grains to supplement the five grains.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renwu day, commanderies and counties were ordered to encourage people to store vegetables and supplementary grains to aid the five main crops.

sentences.zh: 其官有陂池，令得采取，勿收假稅二歲。

translations.literal: Where officials have ponds and pools, allow them to gather from them, do not collect loaned taxes for two years.
translations.idiomatic: Where officials have ponds and reservoirs, permit them to harvest from them without collecting the loaned taxes for two years.

sentences.zh: 冬十月辛未，太尉尹睦薨。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Xinwei day: Grand Marshal Yin Mu passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinwei day of the tenth month of winter, Grand Marshal Yin Mu died.

sentences.zh: 十一月乙丑，太僕張酺為太尉。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Yichou day: Grand Coachman Zhang Pu became Grand Marshal.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yichou day of the eleventh month, Zhang Pu, the Grand Coachman, was appointed Grand Marshal.

sentences.zh: 是歲，武陵郡兵破叛蠻，降之。

translations.literal: This year, Wuling commandery troops defeated the rebelling barbarians, subjugated them.
translations.idiomatic: This year, troops from Wuling commandery defeated the rebelling barbarians and brought them to submission.

sentences.zh: 護羌校尉貫友討燒當羌，羌乃遁去。

translations.literal: Protector General of the Qiang Guan You campaigned against the Shaodang Qiang, the Qiang then fled.
translations.idiomatic: Protector General of the Qiang Guan You campaigned against the Shaodang Qiang tribe, causing them to flee.

sentences.zh: 南單于安國叛，骨都侯喜斬之。

translations.literal: Southern Chanyu An Guo rebelled, Marquis of Gudu Xi executed him.
translations.idiomatic: The Southern Chanyu An Guo rebelled, and the Marquis of Gudu Xi executed him.

sentences.zh: 六年春正月，永昌徼外夷遣使譯獻犀牛、大象。

translations.literal: Sixth year, spring, first month: The barbarians beyond the frontiers of Yongchang sent envoys through interpreters to present rhinoceroses and elephants.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the sixth year, barbarians from beyond Yongchang's frontiers sent envoys with interpreters to present rhinoceroses and elephants as tribute.

sentences.zh: 己卯，司徒丁鴻薨。

translations.literal: Jimao day: Minister of the Masses Ding Hong passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jimao day, Minister of the Masses Ding Hong died.

sentences.zh: 二月乙未，遣謁者分行稟貸三河、兗、冀、青州貧民。

translations.literal: Second month, Yiyou day: Dispatched palace attendants to separately provide grain loans to the poor people of Sanhe, Yan, Ji, and Qing provinces.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day of the second month, palace attendants were dispatched to separately provide grain loans to the poor in the Sanhe region, Yan province, Ji province, and Qing province.

sentences.zh: 許侯馬光自殺。

translations.literal: Marquis of Xu Ma Guang committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Ma Guang, Marquis of Xu, committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 丁未，司空劉方為司徒，太常張奮為司空。

translations.literal: Dingwei day: Minister of Works Liu Fang became Minister of the Masses, Grand Herald Zhang Fen became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingwei day, Liu Fang was appointed Minister of the Masses, and Zhang Fen, the Grand Herald, was appointed Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 三月庚寅，詔流民所過郡國皆實稟之，其有販賣者勿出租稅，又欲就賤還歸者，復一歲田租、更賦。

translations.literal: Third month, Gengyin day: Imperial edict that all commanderies and kingdoms through which displaced people pass provide them with actual grain, those who engage in trade do not pay land taxes, moreover those who wish to return to cheap lands are exempted from one year's land taxes and poll taxes.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengyin day of the third month, an imperial edict ordered that all commanderies and kingdoms through which displaced people travel provide them with actual grain supplies; those who engage in petty trade are exempted from land taxes; and those who wish to return to cheaper lands are exempted from one year's land taxes and poll taxes.

sentences.zh: 丙寅，詔曰：『朕以眇末，承奉鴻烈。

translations.literal: Bingyin day: Imperial edict said: 'I with insignificant person, uphold the great achievement.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day, an imperial edict stated: 'I, being unworthy and insignificant, uphold our great imperial legacy.'

sentences.zh: 陰陽不和，水旱違度，濟、河之域，凶饉流亡，而未獲忠言至謀，所以匡救之策。

translations.literal: Yin and yang are not harmonious, floods and droughts exceed proper measure, in the region of the Ji and Yellow rivers, famine and displacement, yet I have not obtained loyal words and supreme plans, the strategies for correcting and saving.
translations.idiomatic: Yin and yang are out of harmony, floods and droughts exceed normal bounds; in the region of the Ji and Yellow Rivers, famine and displacement occur; yet I have not received loyal counsel and supreme strategies for correcting and rescuing the situation.

sentences.zh: 寤寐永歎，用思孔疚。

translations.literal: Awake and asleep eternal sighing, with thought greatly remorseful.
translations.idiomatic: Constantly sighing whether awake or asleep, filled with deep remorse.

sentences.zh: 惟官人不得於上，黎民不安于下，有司不念寬和，而競為苛刻，覆案不急，以妨民事，甚非所以上當天心，下濟元元也。

translations.literal: Only officials are not pleasing above, the common people are not peaceful below, the officials do not think of leniency and harmony, but compete to be harsh and severe, reviewing cases not urgently, thus hindering people's affairs, very much not the way to accord with Heaven's will above and aid the common people below.
translations.idiomatic: Officials fail to please those above, while the common people find no peace below; officials think not of leniency and harmony but compete in harshness and severity; they review cases without urgency, thus hindering people's affairs—this is far from what accords with Heaven's will above and aids the common people below.

sentences.zh: 思得忠良之士，以輔朕之不逮。

translations.literal: I think of obtaining loyal and good men, to assist my deficiencies.
translations.idiomatic: I seek loyal and worthy men to assist me in my shortcomings.

sentences.zh: 其令三公、中二千石、二千石、內郡守相舉賢良方正、能直言極諫之士各一人。

translations.literal: Let the Three Dukes, middle two thousand shi, two thousand shi, and inner commandery governors and chancellors recommend worthy and good, upright and proper men, able to speak directly and remonstrate to the utmost, each one person.
translations.idiomatic: Let the Three Dukes, officials of middle two thousand shi rank, officials of two thousand shi rank, and the governors and chancellors of the inner commanderies each recommend one worthy and good man who is upright and proper, able to speak directly and remonstrate to the utmost.

sentences.zh: 昭巖穴，披幽隱，遣詣公車，朕將悉聽焉。』

translations.literal: Make clear rocky caves, uncover hidden recluses, send them to the public carriage, I will completely listen to them.''
translations.idiomatic: Seek out those in rocky caves and hidden retreats, send them to the imperial audience hall, for I shall listen to them completely.''

sentences.zh: 帝乃親臨策問，選補郎吏。

translations.literal: The Emperor then personally attended the policy questions, selected and filled court gentleman officials.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor then personally attended the examinations, selecting and appointing court officials.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，蜀郡徼外羌率種人遣使內附。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: The Qiang beyond the frontiers of Shu commandery led their tribesmen and sent envoys to submit internally.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, the Qiang tribes beyond Shu commandery's frontiers, led by their chiefs, sent envoys to submit and join us.

sentences.zh: 五月，城陽王淑薨，無子，國除。

translations.literal: Fifth month: King Shu of Chengyang passed away, had no son, kingdom abolished.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, King Shu of Chengyang died without a son, and his kingdom was abolished.

sentences.zh: 六月己酉，初令伏閉盡日。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Jiyou day: For the first time ordered the closing of the imperial tombs for the entire day.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiyou day of the sixth month, it was first ordered that the imperial tombs remain closed for the entire day.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，京師旱。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: The capital suffered drought.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, the capital experienced drought.

sentences.zh: 詔中都官徒各除半刑，讁其未竟，五月已下皆免遣。

translations.literal: Imperial edict that central office convicts each have half their sentence removed, pity those whose sentences are not yet complete, five months and below are all pardoned and sent away.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, convicts in the central offices each had half their sentences reduced; those whose sentences were not yet complete were shown mercy; those with sentences of five months or less were all pardoned and released.

sentences.zh: 丁巳，幸洛陽寺，錄囚徒，舉冤獄。

translations.literal: Dingsi day: Made a progress to Luoyang Temple, reviewed prisoners, raised up unjust cases.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingsi day, he visited the Luoyang Temple, reviewed the prisoners, and brought attention to unjust cases.

sentences.zh: 收洛陽令下獄抵罪，司隸校尉、河南尹皆左降。

translations.literal: Arrested the Luoyang magistrate, imprisoned him to pay for his crime, the Commandant of the Capital Region and Henan prefect were both demoted.
translations.idiomatic: The Luoyang magistrate was arrested and imprisoned to atone for his crimes; the Commandant of the Capital Region and the Henan prefect were both demoted.

sentences.zh: 未及還宮而澍雨。

translations.literal: Before returning to the palace, timely rain fell.
translations.idiomatic: Before he could return to the palace, beneficial rain began to fall.

sentences.zh: 西域都護班超大破焉耆、尉犁，斬其王。

translations.literal: Western Regions Protector General Ban Chao greatly defeated Yanqi and Weili, executed their kings.
translations.idiomatic: Protector General Ban Chao of the Western Regions inflicted major defeats on Yanqi and Weili, executing their kings.

sentences.zh: 自是西域降服，納質者五十餘國。

translations.literal: From this the Western Regions submitted and yielded, those presenting hostages more than fifty kingdoms.
translations.idiomatic: From this point, the Western Regions submitted and yielded, with more than fifty kingdoms presenting hostages.

sentences.zh: 南單于安國從弟子逢侯率叛胡亡出塞。

translations.literal: Southern Chanyu An Guo's younger brother's son Feng Hou led the rebelling Xiongnu and fled out beyond the frontier.
translations.idiomatic: Feng Hou, the nephew of Southern Chanyu An Guo, led the rebelling Xiongnu and fled beyond the frontier.

sentences.zh: 九月癸丑，以光祿勳鄧鴻行車騎將軍事，與越騎校尉馮柱、行度遼將軍朱徽、使匈奴中郎將杜崇討之。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Guiyou day: Appointed Guanglu Xun Deng Hong to act as Cavalry General, together with Cavalry Colonel Feng Zhu, Acting General of Diao Liao Zhu Hui, and Colonel Envoy to the Xiongnu Du Chong to campaign against them.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day of the ninth month, Guanglu Xun Deng Hong was appointed to act as Cavalry General, together with Cavalry Colonel Feng Zhu, Acting General of Diao Liao Zhu Hui, and Colonel Envoy to the Xiongnu Du Chong to campaign against the rebels.

sentences.zh: 冬十一月，護烏桓校尉任尚率烏桓、鮮卑，大破逢侯，馮柱遣兵追擊，復破之。

translations.literal: Winter, eleventh month: Protector General of the Wuhuan Ren Shang led the Wuhuan and Xianbei, greatly defeated Feng Hou, Feng Zhu dispatched troops to pursue and attack, again defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month of winter, Protector General of the Wuhuan Ren Shang led the Wuhuan and Xianbei tribes to inflict a major defeat on Feng Hou; Feng Zhu dispatched troops to pursue and attack, defeating them again.

sentences.zh: 詔以勃海郡屬冀州。

translations.literal: Imperial edict to attach Bohai commandery to Jizhou.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, Bohai commandery was attached to Jizhou province.

sentences.zh: 武陵漊中蠻叛，郡兵討平之。

translations.literal: Wuling Lizhong barbarians rebelled, commandery troops campaigned and pacified them.
translations.idiomatic: The barbarians in Wuling and Lizhong rebelled, but commandery troops campaigned against and pacified them.

sentences.zh: 七年春正月，行車騎將軍鄧鴻、度遼將軍朱徽、中郎將杜崇皆下獄死。

translations.literal: Seventh year, spring, first month: Acting Cavalry General Deng Hong, General of Diao Liao Zhu Hui, Colonel Du Chong all were imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the seventh year, Acting Cavalry General Deng Hong, General of Diao Liao Zhu Hui, and Colonel Du Chong were all imprisoned and executed.

sentences.zh: 夏四月辛亥朔，日有食之。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Xinhai day, first day of the month: There was a solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the first day of the fourth month of summer, the Xinhai day, there was an eclipse of the sun.

sentences.zh: 帝引見公卿問得失，令將、大夫、御史、謁者、博士、議郎、郎官會廷中，各言封事。

translations.literal: The Emperor summoned and saw the dukes and ministers to ask about successes and failures, ordered the generals, grandees, censors, palace attendants, erudites, deliberative gentlemen, and court gentlemen to assemble in the court, each to speak of sealed memorials.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor summoned the dukes and ministers to inquire about successes and failures; he ordered the generals, grandees, censors, palace attendants, erudites, deliberative gentlemen, and court officials to assemble in the court, each to present their sealed memorials.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『元首不明，化流無良，政失於民，讁見於天。

translations.literal: Imperial edict said: 'The ruler is unenlightened, the transformation flows without goodness, governance fails with the people, pity appears in Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: An imperial edict stated: 'The ruler is unenlightened, the moral transformation lacks goodness, governance fails the people, and Heaven shows its pity.'

sentences.zh: 深惟庶事，五教在寬，是以舊典因孝廉之舉，以求其人。

translations.literal: Deeply considering all matters, the five teachings are in leniency, therefore the old institutions follow the recommendation of the filial and incorruptible, to seek such men.
translations.idiomatic: Deeply considering all matters, the five moral teachings lie in leniency; therefore the old institutions follow the recommendation of the filial and incorruptible to seek such worthy men.

sentences.zh: 有司詳選郎官寬博有謀、才任典城者三十人。』

translations.literal: The officials carefully select court gentlemen who are broad-minded and have plans, talented enough to administer cities, thirty persons.''
translations.idiomatic: The officials shall carefully select thirty court gentlemen who are broad-minded and strategic, with the talent to administer cities.''

sentences.zh: 既而悉以所選郎出補長、相。

translations.literal: Soon after, all the selected court gentlemen were sent out to fill the positions of magistrates and chancellors.
translations.idiomatic: Shortly thereafter, all the selected court gentlemen were sent out to fill the positions of county magistrates and provincial governors.

sentences.zh: 五月辛卯，改千乘國為樂安國。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Xinmao day: Changed Qiansheng kingdom to Le'an kingdom.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the fifth month, the kingdom of Qiansheng was changed to the kingdom of Le'an.

sentences.zh: 六月丙寅，沛王定薨。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Bingyin day: King Ding of Pei passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the sixth month, King Ding of Pei died.

sentences.zh: 秋七月乙巳，易陽地裂。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Yisi day: Yiyang experienced a fissure in the earth.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yisi day of the seventh month of autumn, Yiyang suffered a fissure in the ground.

sentences.zh: 九月癸卯，京師地震。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Guimao day: The capital experienced an earthquake.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guimao day of the ninth month, the capital suffered an earthquake.

sentences.zh: 八年春二月己丑，立貴人陰氏為皇后。

translations.literal: Eighth year, spring, second month, Jichou day: Established the Honored Lady Yin as Empress.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jichou day of the second month of spring in the eighth year, the Honored Lady Yin was established as Empress.

sentences.zh: 賜天下男子爵，人二級，三老、孝悌、力田三級，民無名數及流民欲占者一級；

translations.literal: Granted noble ranks to all males throughout the realm, each two levels; to the Three Elders, the filial and brotherly, and the diligent farmers three levels; to the people without registered households and displaced people wishing to register one level;
translations.idiomatic: Noble ranks were granted to all males throughout the empire: two levels each; three levels to the Three Elders, the filial and brotherly, and diligent farmers; one level to unregistered people and displaced persons wishing to register;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃，貧不能自存者粟，人五斛。

translations.literal: Widowers, widows, orphans, the solitary, the gravely ill, the poor who cannot support themselves: grain, each five dou.
translations.idiomatic: Widowers, widows, orphans, the childless elderly, the gravely ill, and the impoverished who cannot sustain themselves each received five dou of grain.

sentences.zh: 南匈奴右溫禺犢王叛，為寇。

translations.literal: Southern Xiongnu Right Wen Yu Du King rebelled, became a raider.
translations.idiomatic: The Right Wen Yu Du King of the Southern Xiongnu rebelled and became a raider.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，行度遼將軍龐奮、越騎校尉馮柱追討之，斬右溫禺犢王。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: Acting General of Diao Liao Pang Fen, Cavalry Colonel Feng Zhu pursued and campaigned against him, executed the Right Wen Yu Du King.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, Acting General of Diao Liao Pang Fen and Cavalry Colonel Feng Zhu pursued and campaigned against the rebel, executing the Right Wen Yu Du King.

sentences.zh: 車師後王叛，擊其前王。

translations.literal: Cheshi Rear King rebelled, attacked its Front King.
translations.idiomatic: The Rear King of Cheshi rebelled and attacked its Front King.

sentences.zh: 八月辛酉，飲酎。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Xinyou day: Drank the autumn sacrifice wine.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day of the eighth month, he drank the autumn sacrifice wine.

sentences.zh: 詔郡國中都官繫囚減死一等，詣敦煌戍。

translations.literal: Imperial edict that commandery and kingdom central office imprisoned convicts have their death sentences reduced one degree, proceed to Dunhuang garrison duty.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, convicts imprisoned in commandery and kingdom central offices had their death sentences reduced by one degree and were sent to garrison duty in Dunhuang.

sentences.zh: 其犯大逆，募下蠶室；

translations.literal: Those who committed great rebellion, sent to the silkworm chamber;
translations.idiomatic: Those guilty of great rebellion were sent to the silkworm chamber;

sentences.zh: 其女子宮。

translations.literal: their female relatives to the women's quarters.
translations.idiomatic: and their female relatives to the women's quarters.

sentences.zh: 自死罪已下，至司寇及亡命者入贖，各有差。

translations.literal: From death sentences downward, to prison guards and fugitives may redeem, each according to their circumstances.
translations.idiomatic: Those with death sentences and below, including prison guards and fugitives, could redeem their sentences, each according to their specific circumstances.

sentences.zh: 九月，京師蝗。

translations.literal: Ninth month: The capital had locusts.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, locusts infested the capital.

sentences.zh: 吏民言事者，多歸責有司。

translations.literal: Officials and commoners who spoke on affairs, mostly attributed blame to the officials.
translations.idiomatic: When officials and commoners spoke on matters, they mostly attributed blame to the authorities.

sentences.zh: 詔曰：『蝗蟲之異，殆不虛生，萬方有罪，在予一人，而言事者專咎自下，非助我者也。

translations.literal: Imperial edict said: 'The portent of locusts probably does not arise without cause, the ten thousand regions have sin, it is in me alone, yet those who speak on affairs exclusively blame from below, they are not helping me.
translations.idiomatic: An imperial edict stated: 'The ominous appearance of locusts surely does not occur without reason; if all the realms are guilty, the fault lies with me alone; yet those who speak on affairs blame only those below, which does not help me.'

sentences.zh: 朕寤寐恫矜，思弭憂釁。

translations.literal: I constantly feel sorrow and compassion whether awake or asleep, thinking of ending sorrow and calamity.
translations.idiomatic: I am constantly filled with sorrow and compassion, awake and asleep, seeking to end the sorrow and avert disaster.

sentences.zh: 昔楚嚴無灾而懼，成王出郊而反風。

translations.literal: Formerly King Zhuang of Chu feared without disaster, King Cheng went out to the suburbs and the wind reversed.
translations.idiomatic: In the past, King Zhuang of Chu felt fear even without disaster, and King Cheng went to the suburbs and the wind changed direction.

sentences.zh: 將何以匡朕不逮，以塞灾變？

translations.literal: How can you correct my shortcomings, to block calamities and changes?
translations.idiomatic: How can you correct my deficiencies and avert these calamities and portents?

sentences.zh: 百僚師尹，勉修厥職，刺史、二千石詳刑辟，理冤虐，恤鰥寡，矜孤弱，思惟致灾興蝗之咎。』

translations.literal: All officials and tutors, diligently attend to your duties, inspectors and two thousand shi officials carefully examine criminal law, settle unjust oppression, care for widowers and widows, pity orphans and the weak, reflect on the guilt that brings disaster and raises locusts.''
translations.idiomatic: All officials and mentors, diligently perform your duties; inspectors and officials of two thousand shi rank carefully examine the criminal code, rectify unjust oppression, care for widowers and widows, pity orphans and the weak, and reflect on the guilt that causes disasters and brings forth locusts.''

sentences.zh: 庚子，復置廣陽郡。

translations.literal: Gengzi day: Again established Guangyang commandery.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day, Guangyang commandery was reestablished.

sentences.zh: 九年春正月，永昌徼外蠻夷及撣國重譯奉貢。

translations.literal: Ninth year, spring, first month: The barbarians beyond the frontiers of Yongchang and the Shan kingdom through multiple interpreters presented tribute.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of spring of the ninth year, barbarians from beyond Yongchang's frontiers and the Shan kingdom sent envoys through multiple interpreters to present tribute.

sentences.zh: 三月庚辰，隴西地震。

translations.literal: Third month, Gengchen day: Longxi experienced an earthquake.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengchen day of the third month, Longxi commandery suffered an earthquake.

sentences.zh: 癸巳，濟南王康薨。

translations.literal: Guisi day: King Kang of Jinan passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guisi day, King Kang of Jinan died.

sentences.zh: 西域長史王林擊車師後王，斬之。

translations.literal: Western Regions Grand Administrator Wang Lin attacked the Cheshi Rear King, executed him.
translations.idiomatic: Wang Lin, Grand Administrator of the Western Regions, attacked the Rear King of Cheshi and executed him.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丁卯，封樂成王黨子巡為樂成王。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Dingmao day: Enfeoffed King Dang of Yuecheng's son Xun as King of Yuecheng.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day of the fourth month of summer, King Dang of Yuecheng's son Xun was enfeoffed as King of Yuecheng.

sentences.zh: 六月，蝗、旱。

translations.literal: Sixth month: locusts and drought.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, there were locust infestations and drought.

sentences.zh: 戊辰，詔：『今年秋稼為蝗蟲所傷，皆勿收租、更、芻稾；

translations.literal: Wuchen day: Imperial edict: 'This year the autumn crops have been injured by locusts, all do not collect land taxes, poll taxes, and fodder;
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day, an imperial edict stated: 'This year's autumn crops have been damaged by locusts; all land taxes, poll taxes, and fodder shall not be collected;'

sentences.zh: 若有所損失，以實除之，餘當收租者亦半入。

translations.literal: if there are losses, remove them based on actual conditions, the remainder that should collect taxes also enter half.
translations.idiomatic: for areas with losses, remove them according to the actual damage; for the remainder that should collect taxes, collect only half.

sentences.zh: 其山林饒利，陂池漁采，以贍元元，勿收假稅。』

translations.literal: The abundant profits of mountains and forests, ponds and pools fishing and gathering, to support the common people, do not collect loaned taxes.''
translations.idiomatic: The abundant resources of mountains and forests, and the fishing and gathering from ponds and pools shall support the common people; loaned taxes shall not be collected.''

sentences.zh: 秋七月，蝗蟲飛過京師。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: Locusts flew over the capital.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, locusts flew over the capital.

sentences.zh: 八月，鮮卑寇肥如，遼東太守祭參下獄死。

translations.literal: Eighth month: The Xianbei raided Feiru, Liaodong Governor Ji Can was imprisoned and died.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, the Xianbei raided Feiru; Liaodong Governor Ji Can was imprisoned and executed.

sentences.zh: 閏月辛巳，皇太后竇氏崩。

translations.literal: Intercalary month, Xinsi day: Empress Dowager Dou passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinsi day of the intercalary month, Empress Dowager Dou died.

sentences.zh: 丙申，葬章德皇后。

translations.literal: Bingshen day: Buried Empress Zhangde.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingshen day, Empress Zhangde was buried.

sentences.zh: 燒當羌寇隴西，殺長吏，遣行征西將軍劉尚、越騎校尉趙世等討破之。

translations.literal: Shaodang Qiang raided Longxi, killed senior officials, dispatched Acting General of the West Liu Shang, Cavalry Colonel Zhao Shi and others to campaign and defeat them.
translations.idiomatic: The Shaodang Qiang raided Longxi and killed senior officials; Acting General of the West Liu Shang and Cavalry Colonel Zhao Shi were dispatched to campaign against and defeat them.

sentences.zh: 九月庚申，司徒劉方策免，自殺。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Gengshen day: Minister of the Masses Liu Fang was dismissed by edict, committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengshen day of the ninth month, Minister of the Masses Liu Fang was dismissed by imperial edict and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 甲子，追尊皇妣梁貴人為皇太后。

translations.literal: Jiazi day: Posthumously honored the imperial mother Liang Honored Lady as Empress Dowager.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day, the emperor's mother, Liang the Honored Lady, was posthumously honored as Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 冬十月乙酉，改葬恭懷梁皇后于西陵。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Yiyou day: Reburied Empress Gonghuai Liang in the Western Mausoleum.
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day of the tenth month of winter, Empress Gonghuai Liang was reburied in the Western Mausoleum.

sentences.zh: 十一月癸卯，光祿勳河南呂蓋為司徒。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Guimao day: Guanglu Xun Henan Lu Gai became Minister of the Masses.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guimao day of the eleventh month, Lu Gai of Henan, the Guanglu Xun, was appointed Minister of the Masses.

sentences.zh: 十二月丙寅，司空張奮罷。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Bingyin day: Minister of Works Zhang Fen was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the twelfth month, Minister of Works Zhang Fen was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 壬申，太僕韓稜為司空。

translations.literal: Renshen day: Grand Coachman Han Ling became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renshen day, Han Ling, the Grand Coachman, was appointed Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 己丑，復置若廬獄官。

translations.literal: Jichou day: Again established the Rulu prison officials.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jichou day, the Rulu prison officials were reestablished.

sentences.zh: 十年春三月壬戌，詔曰：『堤防溝渠，所以順助地理，通利壅塞。

translations.literal: Tenth year, spring, third month, Renxu day: Imperial edict said: 'Dikes, barriers, ditches, and canals are for following and assisting the earth's configuration, opening and benefiting blockages.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renxu day of the third month of spring in the tenth year, an imperial edict stated: 'Dikes, barriers, ditches, and canals serve to follow and assist the earth's natural configuration by opening and benefiting blockages.'

sentences.zh: 今廢慢懈弛，不以為負。

translations.literal: Now they are abandoned and neglected, slack and remiss, not considered a responsibility.
translations.idiomatic: Now they are abandoned and neglected, slack and remiss, and no one considers it their responsibility.

sentences.zh: 刺史、二千石其隨宜疏導。

translations.literal: Inspectors and two thousand shi officials should dredge and guide according to what is appropriate.
translations.idiomatic: The inspectors and officials of two thousand shi rank should dredge and direct according to local conditions.

sentences.zh: 勿因緣妄發，以為煩擾，將顯行其罰。』

translations.literal: Do not arbitrarily mobilize based on connections, causing disturbance and trouble, I will clearly execute their punishments.''
translations.idiomatic: Do not mobilize forces arbitrarily based on connections, causing disturbance and trouble; their punishments will be clearly enforced.''

sentences.zh: 夏五月，京師大水。

translations.literal: Summer, fifth month: The capital suffered severe flooding.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month of summer, the capital experienced severe flooding.

sentences.zh: 秋七月己巳，司空韓稜薨。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Jisi day: Minister of Works Han Ling passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jisi day of the seventh month of autumn, Minister of Works Han Ling died.

sentences.zh: 八月丙子，太常太山巢堪為司空。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Bingzi day: Grand Herald of Taishan Chao Kan became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingzi day of the eighth month, Chao Kan of Taishan, the Grand Herald, was appointed Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 九月庚戌，復置廩犧官。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Gengxu day: Again established the Linxi officials.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengxu day of the ninth month, the Linxi officials were reestablished.

sentences.zh: 冬十月，五州雨水。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month: Five provinces experienced flooding.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of winter, five provinces suffered from flooding.

sentences.zh: 十二月，燒當羌豪迷唐等率種人詣闕貢獻。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: Shaodang Qiang chieftains Mi Tang and others led their tribesmen to the court to present tribute.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, the Shaodang Qiang chieftains Mi Tang and others led their tribesmen to the imperial court to present tribute.

sentences.zh: 戊寅，梁王暢薨。

translations.literal: Wuyin day: King Chang of Liang passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuyin day, King Chang of Liang died.

sentences.zh: 十一年春二月，遣使循行郡國，稟貸被灾害不能自存者，令得漁采山林池澤，不收假稅。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, spring, second month: Dispatched envoys to tour the commanderies and kingdoms, providing grain loans to those suffering disasters who cannot support themselves, allowing them to fish and gather in mountains, forests, ponds, and marshes, not collecting loaned taxes.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of spring of the eleventh year, envoys were dispatched to tour the commanderies and kingdoms, providing grain loans to those suffering from disasters who cannot support themselves; they were permitted to fish and gather in mountains, forests, ponds, and marshes without collecting loaned taxes.

sentences.zh: 丙午，詔郡國中都官徒及篤癃老小女徒各除半刑，其未竟三月者，皆免歸田里。

translations.literal: Bingwu day: Imperial edict that commandery and kingdom central office convicts and severely ill, elderly, small, and female convicts each have half their sentence removed, those whose sentences are not yet complete within three months, all pardoned and returned to their fields and villages.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingwu day, by imperial edict, convicts in commandery and kingdom central offices and those who are severely ill, elderly, young, or female had their sentences reduced by half; those with less than three months remaining were all pardoned and returned to their homes.

sentences.zh: 夏四月丙寅，大赦天下。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Bingyin day: Great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the fourth month of summer, a general amnesty was granted throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 己巳，復置右校尉官。

translations.literal: Jisi day: Again established the Right Colonel official.
