translations.idiomatic: On the Jisi day, the Right Colonel official was reestablished.

sentences.zh: 秋七月辛卯，詔曰：『吏民逾僭，厚死傷生，是以舊令節之制度。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Xinmao day: Imperial edict said: 'Officials and people exceed their station, lavish funerals harm life, therefore the old regulations restrict their institutions.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the seventh month of autumn, an imperial edict stated: 'Officials and commoners exceed their proper stations, and extravagant funerals harm life; therefore the old regulations restrict such practices.'

sentences.zh: 頃者貴戚近親，百僚師尹，莫肯率從，有司不舉，怠放日甚。

translations.literal: Recently the noble relatives and close kin, all the officials and mentors, none are willing to follow, the officials do not report, negligence and laxity increase daily.
translations.idiomatic: Recently, noble relatives and close kin, as well as all officials and mentors, have been unwilling to comply; the authorities do not report violations, and negligence grows worse day by day.

sentences.zh: 又商賈小民，或忘法禁，奇巧靡貨，流積公行。

translations.literal: Moreover merchants and small people, some forget legal prohibitions, strange and clever wasteful goods, flow and accumulate in public circulation.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, merchants and common people sometimes forget legal prohibitions, with strange and extravagant luxury goods flowing and accumulating in open circulation.

sentences.zh: 其在位犯者，當先舉正。

translations.literal: Those in office who violate, should first be corrected and regulated.
translations.idiomatic: Those in office who commit violations should first be corrected and regulated.

sentences.zh: 市道小民，但且申明憲綱，勿因科令，加虐羸弱。』

translations.literal: Market streets and small people, for now just clarify the constitutional principles, do not because of regulations and orders, add abuse to the weak and feeble.''
translations.idiomatic: For merchants in the markets and common people, for now just clarify the legal principles; do not add further abuse to the weak and feeble because of regulations and orders.''

sentences.zh: 十二年春二月，旄牛徼外白狼、貗薄夷率種人內屬。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, spring, second month: The Bai Lang and Zhu Bo barbarians beyond the Maoniu frontier led their tribesmen to submit internally.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month of spring of the twelfth year, the Bai Lang and Zhu Bo barbarians from beyond the Maoniu frontier led their tribesmen to submit and join us.

sentences.zh: 詔貸被灾諸郡民種糧。

translations.literal: Imperial edict to loan seed grain to the people of various commanderies suffering disasters.
translations.idiomatic: By imperial edict, seed grain was loaned to the people of the various commanderies affected by disasters.

sentences.zh: 賜下貧、鰥、寡、孤、獨、不能自存者，及郡國流民，聽入陂池漁采，以助蔬食。

translations.literal: Granted to the lower poor, widowers, widows, orphans, the solitary, those who cannot support themselves, and commandery and kingdom displaced people, allowed to enter ponds and pools to fish and gather, to supplement their vegetable food.
translations.idiomatic: Grants were made to the lower poor, widowers, widows, orphans, the childless elderly, those unable to support themselves, and displaced people from commanderies and kingdoms; they were permitted to fish and gather in ponds and reservoirs to supplement their vegetable diet.

sentences.zh: 三月丙申，詔曰：『比年不登，百姓虛匱。

translations.literal: Third month, Bingchen day: Imperial edict said: 'In recent years harvests have failed, the common people are empty and lacking.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day of the third month, an imperial edict stated: 'Harvests have failed in recent years, leaving the common people destitute and impoverished.'

sentences.zh: 京師去冬無宿雪，今春無澍雨，黎民流離，困於道路。

translations.literal: The capital last winter had no lasting snow, this spring no beneficial rain, the common people are displaced and scattered, distressed on the roads.
translations.idiomatic: Last winter the capital had no lasting snow, this spring no beneficial rain has fallen; the common people are displaced and wandering, suffering hardship on the roads.

sentences.zh: 朕痛心疾首，靡知所濟。

translations.literal: I am pained in heart and head, know not what to do for relief.
translations.idiomatic: My heart and head ache with pain; I know not how to provide relief.

sentences.zh: 「瞻仰昊天，何辜今人？」

translations.literal: 'Gazing up at Vast Heaven, what guilt have the present people?'
translations.idiomatic: 'Gazing up at the vast heavens, what guilt do the people of today bear?'

sentences.zh: 三公，朕之腹心，而未獲承天安民之策。

translations.literal: The Three Dukes are my innermost heart, yet I have not obtained strategies for receiving Heaven and pacifying the people.
translations.idiomatic: The Three Dukes are my closest advisors, yet I have not obtained strategies for following Heaven's will and bringing peace to the people.

sentences.zh: 數詔有司，務擇良吏。

translations.literal: I have repeatedly instructed the officials to diligently select good administrators.
translations.idiomatic: I have repeatedly instructed the authorities to diligently select worthy officials.

sentences.zh: 今猶不改，競為苛暴，侵愁小民，以求虛名，委任下吏，假勢行邪。

translations.literal: Now still not changed, compete to be harsh and violent, invade and trouble the small people, to seek empty reputation, entrust lower officials, borrow influence to do evil.
translations.idiomatic: Yet still they do not change; they compete to be harsh and tyrannical, oppressing and troubling the common people to gain empty reputations; they entrust subordinate officials who abuse their borrowed authority to commit evil.

sentences.zh: 是以令下而蕊生，禁至而詐起。

translations.literal: Therefore commands descend and buds sprout, prohibitions arrive and deception arises.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore when commands are issued, corruption sprouts; when prohibitions are established, deception arises.

sentences.zh: 巧法析律，飾文增辭，貨行於言，罪成乎手，朕甚病焉。

translations.literal: Cleverly manipulate laws and analyze statutes, embellish writings and add words, bribes circulate through speech, crimes are formed by hand, I greatly suffer from this.
translations.idiomatic: They cleverly manipulate laws and parse statutes, embellish documents and add words; bribes circulate through speech, crimes are committed by hand—I am greatly troubled by this.

sentences.zh: 公卿不思助明好惡，將何以救其咎罰？

translations.literal: Dukes and ministers do not think to help clarify likes and dislikes, how can they save themselves from blame and punishment?
translations.idiomatic: If dukes and ministers do not help clarify right and wrong, how can they save themselves from blame and punishment?

sentences.zh: 咎罰既至，復令灾及小民。

translations.literal: Blame and punishment having arrived, moreover causing disasters to affect the small people.
translations.idiomatic: Once blame and punishment arrive, moreover causing disasters to afflict the common people.

sentences.zh: 若上下同心，庶或有廖。

translations.literal: If superiors and inferiors are of one heart, perhaps there will be some relief.
translations.idiomatic: If superiors and inferiors unite in purpose, perhaps some relief may be achieved.

sentences.zh: 其賜天下男子爵，人二級，三老、孝悌、力田三級，民無名數及流民欲占者人一級；

translations.literal: Grant noble ranks to all males throughout the realm, each two levels; to the Three Elders, the filial and brotherly, and the diligent farmers three levels; to the people without registered households and displaced people wishing to register each one level;
translations.idiomatic: Noble ranks were granted to all males throughout the empire: two levels each; three levels to the Three Elders, the filial and brotherly, and diligent farmers; one level to unregistered people and displaced persons wishing to register;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃、貧不能自存者粟，人三斛。』

translations.literal: Widowers, widows, orphans, the solitary, the gravely ill, the poor who cannot support themselves: grain, each three dou.''
translations.idiomatic: Widowers, widows, orphans, the childless elderly, the gravely ill, and the impoverished who cannot sustain themselves each received three dou of grain.''

sentences.zh: 壬子，賜博士員弟子在太學者布，人三匹。

translations.literal: Renzi day: Granted cloth to the disciples of the established Erudite officials who are at the Grand Academy, each three bolts.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renzi day, cloth was granted to the disciples of the established Erudite officials at the Grand Academy, three bolts each.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，日南象林蠻夷反，郡兵討破之。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: The barbarians of Rinan Xianglin rebelled, commandery troops campaigned and defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, the barbarians of Rinan and Xianglin rebelled, but commandery troops campaigned against and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 閏月，賑貸敦煌、張掖、五原民下貧者糓。

translations.literal: Intercalary month: Provided relief loans of grain to the especially poor people of Dunhuang, Zhangye, and Wuquan.
translations.idiomatic: In the intercalary month, relief loans of grain were provided to the especially impoverished people of Dunhuang, Zhangye, and Wuquan commanderies.

sentences.zh: 戊辰，秭歸山崩。

translations.literal: Wuchen day: Zigui Mountain collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day, Zigui Mountain suffered a collapse.

sentences.zh: 六月，舞陽大水，賜被水灾尤貧者穀，人三斛。

translations.literal: Sixth month: Wuyang suffered severe flooding, granted grain to those especially poor who suffered water disaster, each three dou.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Wuyang suffered severe flooding; grain was granted to those particularly impoverished by the flood disaster, three dou each.

sentences.zh: 秋七月辛亥朔，日有食之。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Xinhai day, first day of the month: There was a solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the first day of the seventh month of autumn, the Xinhai day, there was an eclipse of the sun.

sentences.zh: 九月戊午，太尉張酺免。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Wuwu day: Grand Marshal Zhang Pu was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuwu day of the ninth month, Grand Marshal Zhang Pu was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 丙寅，大司農張禹為太尉。

translations.literal: Bingyin day: Grand Minister of Agriculture Zhang Yu became Grand Marshal.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day, Zhang Yu, the Grand Minister of Agriculture, was appointed Grand Marshal.

sentences.zh: 冬十一月，西域蒙奇、兜勒二國遣使內附，賜其王金印紫綬。

translations.literal: Winter, eleventh month: The two kingdoms of Mengqi and Doule in the Western Regions sent envoys to submit internally, granted their kings gold seals and purple tassels.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month of winter, the two kingdoms of Mengqi and Doule in the Western Regions sent envoys to submit and join us; their kings were granted gold seals and purple tassels.

sentences.zh: 是歲，燒當羌復叛。

translations.literal: This year, the Shaodang Qiang rebelled again.
translations.idiomatic: This year, the Shaodang Qiang rebelled once more.

sentences.zh: 十三年春正月丁丑，帝幸東觀，覽書林，閱篇籍，博選術蓺之士以充其官。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, spring, first month, Dingchou day: The Emperor made a progress to the Eastern Pavilion, viewed the forest of books, perused the writings, broadly selected men of arts and skills to fill their offices.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingchou day of the first month of spring in the thirteenth year, the Emperor visited the Eastern Pavilion, viewed the collection of books, perused the writings, and broadly selected men skilled in the arts to fill their official positions.

sentences.zh: 二月，任城王尚薨。

translations.literal: Second month: King Shang of Rencheng passed away.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, King Shang of Rencheng died.

sentences.zh: 丙午，賑貸張掖、居延、朔方、日南貧民及孤、寡、羸弱不能自存者。

translations.literal: Bingwu day: Provided relief loans to the poor people of Zhangye, Juyan, Shuofang, and Rinan, as well as orphans, widows, the feeble, and those who cannot support themselves.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingwu day, relief loans were provided to the impoverished people of Zhangye, Juyan, Shuofang, and Rinan commanderies, as well as to orphans, widows, the feeble, and those unable to support themselves.

sentences.zh: 秋八月，詔象林民失農桑業者，賑貸種糧，稟賜下貧穀食。

translations.literal: Autumn, eighth month: Imperial edict that Xianglin people who have lost their farming and mulberry cultivation be provided relief loans of seed grain, granted grain to the lower poor.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month of autumn, by imperial edict, the people of Xianglin who had lost their farming and mulberry cultivation were provided with relief loans of seed grain and grants of grain for the lower poor.

sentences.zh: 己亥，北宮盛饌門閣火。

translations.literal: Jihai day: The Shengzhan gate pavilion of the Northern Palace caught fire.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jihai day, the Shengzhan gate pavilion of the Northern Palace caught fire.

sentences.zh: 護羌校尉周鮪擊燒當羌，破之，荊州雨水。

translations.literal: Protector General of the Qiang Zhou Wei attacked the Shaodang Qiang, defeated them; Jing province experienced flooding.
translations.idiomatic: Protector General of the Qiang Zhou Wei attacked and defeated the Shaodang Qiang; Jing province suffered from flooding.

sentences.zh: 九月壬子，詔曰：『荊州比歲不節，今茲淫水為害，餘雖頗登，而多不均浹，深惟四民農食之本，慘然懷矜。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Renzi day: Imperial edict said: 'Jing province in recent years has been unseasonable, this year excessive waters have caused harm, the remainder though somewhat harvested, yet mostly not evenly distributed, deeply considering the farming and food foundation of the four classes of people, sorrowfully feeling compassion.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renzi day of the ninth month, an imperial edict stated: 'Jing province has been unseasonable in recent years, and this year excessive flooding has caused harm; although some crops have been harvested, they are mostly not evenly distributed; deeply considering that farming and food are the foundation for the four classes of people, I sorrowfully feel compassion.'

sentences.zh: 其今天下半入今年田租、芻稾；

translations.literal: Let the realm today half pay this year's land taxes and fodder;
translations.idiomatic: Let the entire empire today pay only half of this year's land taxes and fodder;

sentences.zh: 有宜以實除者，如故事。

translations.literal: those who should be exempted based on actual conditions, as in the previous precedents.
translations.idiomatic: for those who should be exempted according to the actual circumstances, follow previous precedents.

sentences.zh: 貧民假種食，皆勿收責。』

translations.literal: The poor people who borrowed seed grain, all do not collect repayment.''
translations.idiomatic: For poor people who borrowed seed grain, repayment shall not be collected.''

sentences.zh: 冬十一月，安息國遣使獻師子及條枝大爵。

translations.literal: Winter, eleventh month: The kingdom of Anxi sent envoys to present lions and large birds from Tiaozhi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month of winter, the kingdom of Anxi sent envoys to present lions and large birds from Tiaozhi.

sentences.zh: 丙辰，詔曰：『幽、幷、涼州戶口率少，邊役眾劇，束脩良吏，進仕路狹。

translations.literal: Bingchen day: Imperial edict said: 'You, Bing, and Liang provinces generally have few households and population, border duties are numerous and arduous, cultivating good officials, the path to advancement is narrow.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingchen day, an imperial edict stated: 'The provinces of You, Bing, and Liang generally have few households and people; border duties are numerous and arduous; cultivating good officials is difficult, and the path to advancement is narrow.'

sentences.zh: 撫接夷狄，以人為本。

translations.literal: Pacifying and receiving the Yi and Di barbarians, taking people as the foundation.
translations.idiomatic: In pacifying and receiving the barbarian tribes, people are the foundation.

sentences.zh: 其令緣邊郡口十萬以上，歲舉孝廉一人；

translations.literal: Let the border commanderies with populations of one hundred thousand or more, annually recommend one filial and incorruptible;
translations.idiomatic: Let border commanderies with populations of 100,000 or more annually recommend one person who is filial and incorruptible;

sentences.zh: 不滿十萬，二歲舉一人；

translations.literal: those not reaching one hundred thousand, every two years recommend one person;
translations.idiomatic: those with fewer than 100,000 people, recommend one person every two years;

sentences.zh: 五萬以下，三歲舉一人。』

translations.literal: fifty thousand and below, every three years recommend one person.''
translations.idiomatic: those with 50,000 or fewer, recommend one person every three years.''

sentences.zh: 鮮卑寇右北平，遂入漁陽，漁陽太守擊破之。

translations.literal: The Xianbei raided Youbeiping, then entered Yuyang, the Yuyang governor attacked and defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: The Xianbei raided Youbeiping, then entered Yuyang, where the governor of Yuyang attacked and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 戊辰，司徒呂蓋罷。

translations.literal: Wuchen day: Minister of the Masses Lu Gai was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuchen day, Minister of the Masses Lu Gai was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，遣使者督荊州兵討巫蠻，破降之。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: Dispatched envoys to oversee Jing province troops campaigning against the Wu barbarians, defeated and subjugated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, envoys were dispatched to oversee Jing province troops in their campaign against the Wu barbarians, who were defeated and brought to submission.

sentences.zh: 庚辰，賑貸張掖、居延、敦煌、五原、漢陽、會稽流民下貧穀，各有差。

translations.literal: Gengchen day: Provided relief loans of grain to the especially poor displaced people of Zhangye, Juyan, Dunhuang, Wuquan, Hanyang, and Kuaiji, each according to their circumstances.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengchen day, relief loans of grain were provided to the especially impoverished displaced people in Zhangye, Juyan, Dunhuang, Wuquan, Hanyang, and Kuaiji commanderies, each according to their specific circumstances.

sentences.zh: 五月丁未，初置象林將兵長史官。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Dingwei day: For the first time established the office of General of the Troops and Grand Administrator of Xianglin.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingwei day of the fifth month, the office of General of the Troops and Grand Administrator of Xianglin was established for the first time.

sentences.zh: 六月辛卯，廢皇后陰氏，后父特進綱自殺。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Xinmao day: Deposed Empress Yin, her father Specially Advanced Gang committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the sixth month, Empress Yin was deposed; her father, the Specially Advanced Gang, committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 秋七月甲寅，詔復象林縣更賦、田租、芻稾二歲。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Jiazi day: Imperial edict to exempt Xianglin county from poll taxes, land taxes, and fodder for two years.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiazi day of the seventh month of autumn, an imperial edict exempted Xianglin county from poll taxes, land taxes, and fodder for two years.

sentences.zh: 壬子，常山王側薨。

translations.literal: Renzi day: King Ce of Changshan passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renzi day, King Ce of Changshan died.

sentences.zh: 是秋，三州雨水。

translations.literal: This autumn, three provinces experienced flooding.
translations.idiomatic: This autumn, three provinces suffered from flooding.

sentences.zh: 冬十月甲申，詔：『兗、豫、荊州今年水雨淫過，多傷農功。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Jiashen day: Imperial edict: 'Yan, Yu, and Jing provinces this year have had excessive flooding, greatly injuring farming efforts.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day of the tenth month of winter, an imperial edict stated: 'Yan, Yu, and Jing provinces have suffered excessive flooding this year, greatly damaging farming efforts.'

sentences.zh: 其令被害什四以上皆半入田租、芻稾；

translations.literal: Let those suffering damage of four-tenths or more all pay half the land taxes and fodder;
translations.idiomatic: Let those areas suffering damage of 40% or more pay only half their land taxes and fodder;

sentences.zh: 其不滿者，以實除之。』

translations.literal: those not reaching that amount, exempt them based on actual conditions.''
translations.idiomatic: for those with less damage, exempt them according to the actual circumstances.''

sentences.zh: 辛卯，立貴人鄧氏為皇后。

translations.literal: Xinmao day: Established the Honored Lady Deng as Empress.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day, the Honored Lady Deng was established as Empress.

sentences.zh: 丁酉，司空巢堪罷。

translations.literal: Dingyou day: Minister of Works Chao Kan was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingyou day, Minister of Works Chao Kan was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 十一月癸卯，大司農徐防為司空。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Guimao day: Grand Minister of Agriculture Xu Fang became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guimao day of the eleventh month, Xu Fang, the Grand Minister of Agriculture, was appointed Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 是歲，初復郡國上計補郎官。

translations.literal: This year, for the first time again allowed commanderies and kingdoms to fill court gentleman positions through their annual tallies.
translations.idiomatic: This year, commanderies and kingdoms were for the first time again allowed to fill court gentleman positions through their annual reports.

sentences.zh: 十五年春閏月乙未，詔流民欲還歸本而無糧食者，過所實稟之，疾病加致醫藥；

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, spring, intercalary month, Yiyou day: Imperial edict that displaced people who wish to return to their native places but lack food, at their stopping places provide them with actual grain, for illness additionally provide medicine;
translations.idiomatic: On the Yiyou day of the intercalary month of spring in the fifteenth year, an imperial edict ordered that displaced people wishing to return to their native places but lacking food be provided with actual grain at their stopping places, and that medicine be provided for the ill;

sentences.zh: 其不欲還歸者，勿強。

translations.literal: those who do not wish to return, do not force them.
translations.idiomatic: those who do not wish to return should not be forced.

sentences.zh: 二月，詔稟貸潁川、汝南、陳留、江夏、梁國、敦煌貧民。

translations.literal: Second month: Imperial edict to provide grain loans to the poor people of Yingchuan, Runan, Chenliu, Jiangxia, Liang kingdom, and Dunhuang.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, by imperial edict, grain loans were provided to the impoverished people of Yingchuan, Runan, Chenliu, Jiangxia, Liang kingdom, and Dunhuang.

sentences.zh: 夏四月甲子晦，日有食之。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Jiazi day, last day of the month: There was a solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: On the last day of the fourth month of summer, the Jiazi day, there was an eclipse of the sun.

sentences.zh: 五月戊寅，南陽大風。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Wuyin day: Nanyang experienced a great wind.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuyin day of the fifth month, Nanyang suffered from violent winds.

sentences.zh: 六月，詔令百姓鰥、寡漁采陂池，勿收假稅二歲。

translations.literal: Sixth month: Imperial edict ordering the common people who are widowers and widows to fish and gather in ponds and reservoirs, do not collect loaned taxes for two years.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, by imperial edict, widowers and widows among the common people were allowed to fish and gather in ponds and reservoirs without collecting loaned taxes for two years.

sentences.zh: 秋七月丙寅，濟南王錯薨。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Bingyin day: King Cuo of Jinan passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingyin day of the seventh month of autumn, King Cuo of Jinan died.

sentences.zh: 復置涿郡故安鐵官。

translations.literal: Again established the iron official in Gu'an of Zhuojun.
translations.idiomatic: The iron official in Gu'an of Zhuojun was reestablished.

sentences.zh: 九月壬午，南巡狩，清河王慶、濟北王壽、河間王開並從。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Renwu day: Made a southern inspection tour, King Qing of Qinghe, King Shou of Jibei, King Kai of Hejian all accompanied.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renwu day of the ninth month, he made a southern inspection tour, accompanied by King Qing of Qinghe, King Shou of Jibei, and King Kai of Hejian.

sentences.zh: 賜所過二千石長吏以下、三老、官屬及民百年者錢、布，各有差。

translations.literal: Granted money and cloth to the two thousand shi senior officials and below that the procession passed, the Three Elders, officials, and people who were one hundred years old, each according to their rank.
translations.idiomatic: Money and cloth were granted to the senior officials of two thousand shi rank and below along the route of the procession, as well as to the Three Elders, other officials, and centenarians, each according to their position.

sentences.zh: 是秋，四州雨水。

translations.literal: This autumn, four provinces experienced flooding.
translations.idiomatic: This autumn, four provinces suffered from flooding.

sentences.zh: 冬十月戊申，幸章陵，祠舊宅。

translations.literal: Winter, tenth month, Wushen day: Made a progress to Zhangling, sacrificed at the old residence.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wushen day of the tenth month of winter, he made a visit to Zhangling and performed sacrifices at the old residence.

sentences.zh: 癸丑，祠園廟，會宗室於舊廬，勞賜作樂。

translations.literal: Guiyou day: Sacrificed at the Garden Temple, assembled the imperial clansmen at the old lodge, rewarded and entertained them with music.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day, he performed sacrifices at the Garden Temple, assembled the imperial clansmen at the old lodge, and entertained them with rewards and music.

sentences.zh: 戊午，進幸雲夢，臨漢水而還。

translations.literal: Wuwu day: Advanced to Yunmeng, viewed the Han River and returned.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuwu day, he proceeded to Yunmeng, viewed the Han River, and returned.

sentences.zh: 十一月甲申，車駕還宮，賜從臣及留者公卿以下錢、布，各有差。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, Jiashen day: The imperial carriage returned to the palace, granted money and cloth to the accompanying ministers and those who remained, dukes and ministers and below, each according to their rank.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day of the eleventh month, the imperial carriage returned to the palace; money and cloth were granted to the accompanying ministers and those who had remained, from dukes and ministers downward, each according to their position.

sentences.zh: 十二月庚子，琅邪王宇薨。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, Gengzi day: King Yu of Langye passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengzi day of the twelfth month, King Yu of Langye died.

sentences.zh: 有司奏，以為夏至則微陰起，靡草死，可以決小事。

translations.literal: The officials memorialized, believing that at the summer solstice then slight yin arises, the luxuriant grasses die, it is possible to decide small matters.
translations.idiomatic: The officials memorialized their belief that at the summer solstice, when slight yin energy begins to rise and the lush grasses wither and die, it becomes possible to decide minor judicial matters.

sentences.zh: 是歲，初令郡國以日北至案薄刑。

translations.literal: This year, for the first time ordered commanderies and kingdoms to review light punishments at the winter solstice.
translations.idiomatic: This year, commanderies and kingdoms were for the first time ordered to review light punishments on the day of the winter solstice.

sentences.zh: 十六年春正月己卯，詔貧民有田業而以匱乏不能自農者，貸種糧。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, spring, first month, Jimao day: Imperial edict that poor people who have landholdings but because of destitution cannot farm themselves, loan seed grain.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jimao day of the first month of spring in the sixteenth year, an imperial edict ordered that poor people who own land but cannot farm it themselves due to destitution be loaned seed grain.

sentences.zh: 二月己未，詔兗、豫、徐、冀四州比年雨多傷稼，禁沽酒。

translations.literal: Second month, Jiwei day: Imperial edict that Yan, Yu, Xu, and Ji four provinces in recent years have had excessive rain injuring the crops, prohibit selling alcohol.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiwei day of the second month, an imperial edict prohibited the sale of alcohol in the four provinces of Yan, Yu, Xu, and Ji, where excessive rains in recent years had damaged the crops.

sentences.zh: 夏四月，遣三府掾分行四州，貧民無以耕者，為雇犁牛直。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month: Dispatched the clerks of the three offices to separately tour the four provinces, for poor people who have no means to plow, provide funds to hire plowing oxen.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month of summer, clerks from the three offices were dispatched to separately tour the four provinces and provide funds to hire oxen for poor people who had no means to plow their fields.

sentences.zh: 五月壬午，趙王商薨。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Renwu day: King Shang of Zhao passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renwu day of the fifth month, King Shang of Zhao died.

sentences.zh: 秋七月，旱。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month: drought.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh month of autumn, there was drought.

sentences.zh: 戊午，詔曰：『今秋稼方穗而旱，雲雨不霑，疑吏行慘刻，不宣恩澤，妄拘無罪，幽閉良善所致。

translations.literal: Wuwu day: Imperial edict said: 'Now the autumn crops are just earing but drought, clouds and rain do not moisten, suspect officials practice harsh severity, do not proclaim benevolent favor, wrongly detain the innocent, imprison the good, what brings this about.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuwu day, an imperial edict stated: 'Now the autumn crops are just forming ears but suffering drought; clouds and rain do not provide moisture. I suspect this is because officials practice harsh severity, do not proclaim benevolent favors, wrongly detain the innocent, and imprison the good.'

sentences.zh: 其一切囚徒於法疑者勿決，以奉秋令。

translations.literal: All prisoners whose cases are doubtful under the law do not decide, to observe the autumn decree.
translations.idiomatic: Do not decide cases for all prisoners where the law is doubtful, in order to observe the autumn decree.

sentences.zh: 方察煩苛之吏，顯明其罰。』

translations.literal: Currently investigating officials who are troublesome and harsh, make their punishments clear.''
translations.idiomatic: Currently investigating officials who are vexatious and harsh, and making their punishments clear.''

sentences.zh: 辛酉，司徒魯恭免。

translations.literal: Xinyou day: Minister of the Masses Lu Gong was dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinyou day, Minister of the Masses Lu Gong was dismissed.

sentences.zh: 庚午，光祿勳張酺為司徒。

translations.literal: Gengwu day: Guanglu Xun Zhang Pu became Minister of the Masses.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengwu day, Zhang Pu, the Guanglu Xun, became Minister of the Masses.

sentences.zh: 辛巳，詔令天下皆半入今年田租、芻稾；

translations.literal: Xinsi day: Imperial edict ordering that throughout the realm all pay half of this year's land taxes and fodder;
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinsi day, an imperial edict ordered that throughout the empire, only half of this year's land taxes and fodder be paid;

sentences.zh: 其被灾害者，以實除之。

translations.literal: Those who suffered disasters, exempt them based on actual conditions.
translations.idiomatic: For those who suffered disasters, exempt them according to the actual circumstances.

sentences.zh: 貧民受貸種糧及田租、芻稾，皆勿收責。

translations.literal: Poor people who received loans of seed grain and land taxes, fodder, all do not collect repayment.
translations.idiomatic: For poor people who received loans of seed grain and exemptions from land taxes and fodder, repayment shall not be collected.

sentences.zh: 十二月，復置遼東西部都尉官。

translations.literal: Twelfth month: Again established the Western Commandant of Liaodong official.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, the Western Commandant of Liaodong official was reestablished.

sentences.zh: 元興元年春正月戊午，引三署郎召見禁中，選除七十五人，補謁者、長、相。

translations.literal: Yuanxing first year, spring, first month, Wuwu day: Summoned the Three Offices gentlemen for audience in the imperial residence, selected and appointed seventy-five persons, filled positions of palace attendants, magistrates, and chancellors.
translations.idiomatic: On the Wuwu day of the first month of spring in the first year of the Yuanxing era, the gentlemen of the Three Offices were summoned for an audience in the imperial residence; seventy-five were selected and appointed to fill positions as palace attendants, county magistrates, and provincial governors.

sentences.zh: 高句驪寇郡界。

translations.literal: Gaogouli raided the commandery borders.
translations.idiomatic: Gaogouli raided the borders of the commandery.

sentences.zh: 夏四月庚午，大赦天下，改元元興。

translations.literal: Summer, fourth month, Gengwu day: Great amnesty throughout the realm, changed the era name to Yuanxing.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengwu day of the fourth month of summer, a general amnesty was granted throughout the empire and the era name was changed to Yuanxing.

sentences.zh: 宗室以罪絕者，悉復屬籍。

translations.literal: Imperial clansmen who had been cut off for crimes, all restored to the clan registers.
translations.idiomatic: All imperial clansmen who had been removed from the clan registers due to crimes were restored to them.

sentences.zh: 五月癸酉，雍地裂。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Guiyou day: Yong experienced a fissure in the earth.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day of the fifth month, Yong suffered a fissure in the ground.

sentences.zh: 秋九月，遼東太守耿夔擊貊人，破之。

translations.literal: Autumn, ninth month: Liaodong Governor Geng Kui attacked the Mo people, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month of autumn, Liaodong Governor Geng Kui attacked the Mo people and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 冬十二月辛未，帝崩於章德前殿，年二十七。

translations.literal: Winter, twelfth month, Xinwei day: The Emperor passed away in the Zhangde Front Hall, aged twenty-seven.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinwei day of the twelfth month of winter, the Emperor died in the Zhangde Front Hall at the age of twenty-seven.

sentences.zh: 立皇子隆為皇太子。

translations.literal: Established the imperial son Long as Crown Prince.
translations.idiomatic: The imperial son Long was established as Crown Prince.

sentences.zh: 賜天下男子爵，人二級，三老、孝悌、力田人三級，民無名數及流民欲占者人一級；

translations.literal: Granted noble ranks to all males throughout the realm, each two levels; to the Three Elders, the filial and brotherly, and the diligent farmers each three levels; to the people without registered households and displaced people wishing to register each one level;
translations.idiomatic: Noble ranks were granted to all males throughout the empire: two levels each; three levels to the Three Elders, the filial and brotherly, and diligent farmers; one level to unregistered people and displaced persons wishing to register;

sentences.zh: 鰥、寡、孤、獨、篤癃、貧不能自存者粟，人三斛。

translations.literal: Widowers, widows, orphans, the solitary, the gravely ill, the poor who cannot support themselves: grain, each three dou.
translations.idiomatic: Widowers, widows, orphans, the childless elderly, the gravely ill, and the impoverished who cannot sustain themselves each received three dou of grain.

sentences.zh: 自竇憲誅後，帝躬親萬機。

translations.literal: After Dou Xian's execution, the Emperor personally attended to the myriad affairs.
translations.idiomatic: After Dou Xian's execution, the Emperor personally handled all state affairs.

sentences.zh: 每有灾異，輒延問公卿，極言得失。

translations.literal: Whenever there were calamities and portents, he would invite and question the dukes and ministers, speaking to the utmost about successes and failures.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever calamities or portents occurred, he would invite the dukes and ministers for questioning and speak frankly about what was going well and what was not.

sentences.zh: 前後符瑞八十一所，自稱德薄，皆抑而不宣。

translations.literal: Before and after auspicious omens in eighty-one places, calling himself of thin virtue, all suppressed and not proclaimed.
translations.idiomatic: Before and after, there were auspicious omens in eighty-one places, but considering himself of insufficient virtue, he suppressed them all and did not proclaim them.

sentences.zh: 舊南海獻龍眼、荔支，十里一置，五里一候，奔騰阻險，死者繼路。

translations.literal: Formerly Nanhai presented longan and litchi, ten li a station, five li a guard, rushing and tumbling over dangerous obstacles, the dead following one after another on the road.
translations.idiomatic: In the past, Nanhai presented longan and litchi fruits; stations were set every ten li and guards every five li; the fruits were rushed over dangerous obstacles, with the dead lying one after another along the road.

sentences.zh: 時臨武長汝南唐羌，縣接南海，乃上書陳狀。

translations.literal: At the time the magistrate of Linwu Runan Tang Qiang, the county bordering Nanhai, then submitted a memorial stating the situation.
translations.idiomatic: At the time, Tang Qiang, magistrate of Linwu in Runan commandery (whose county bordered Nanhai), submitted a memorial describing the situation.

sentences.zh: 帝下詔曰：『遠國珍羞，本以薦奉宗廟，茍有傷害，豈愛民之本。

translations.literal: The Emperor issued an edict saying: 'Distant kingdoms' precious delicacies, originally to present and serve the ancestral temples, if there is harm, how can this be loving the people as the foundation.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor issued an edict stating: 'The precious delicacies from distant kingdoms were originally meant to be presented to the ancestral temples. If they cause harm, how can this be considered loving the people as the foundation?'

sentences.zh: 其勑太官勿復受獻。』

translations.literal: Let the Grand Provisioner be instructed not to receive tribute again.''
translations.idiomatic: Let the Grand Provisioner be instructed not to accept such tribute again.''

sentences.zh: 由是遂省焉。

translations.literal: From this it was then abolished.
translations.idiomatic: From this point, the practice was abolished.

sentences.zh: 論曰：自中興以後，逮於永元，雖頗有弛張，而俱存不擾，是以齊民歲增，闢土世廣。

translations.literal: Discussion says: From after the restoration onward, reaching to Yongyuan, although there was somewhat relaxation and tension, yet both preserved non-disturbance, therefore the common people increased year by year, the opened lands broadened generation by generation.
translations.idiomatic: In discussion: From after the restoration onward, down to the Yongyuan era, although there were periods of relaxation and tension, both preserved a policy of non-interference; therefore the common people increased year by year, and the opened territories broadened generation by generation.

sentences.zh: 偏師出塞，則漠北地空；

translations.literal: Partial armies going out beyond the frontier, then the land north of the desert is empty;
translations.idiomatic: When partial armies went beyond the frontier, the lands north of the desert were emptied;

sentences.zh: 都護西指，則通譯四萬。

translations.literal: the Protector General pointing west, then forty thousand interpreters came.
translations.idiomatic: when the Protector General extended his authority westward, forty thousand interpreters submitted.

sentences.zh: 豈其道遠三代，術長前世？

translations.literal: How could their way be far from the Three Dynasties, their methods surpassing previous ages?
translations.idiomatic: Could it be that their way was far from the Three Dynasties, their methods surpassing previous ages?

sentences.zh: 將服叛去來，自有數也？

translations.literal: Or that submission and rebellion, coming and going, had their own destiny?
translations.idiomatic: Or that submission and rebellion, coming and going, had their own inherent pattern?

sentences.zh: 孝殤皇帝諱隆，和帝少子也。

translations.literal: Emperor Shang of Han, whose personal name was Long, was the youngest son of Emperor He.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Shang of Han, whose personal name was Long, was the youngest son of Emperor He.

sentences.zh: 元興元年十二月辛未夜，即皇帝位，時誕育百餘日。

translations.literal: Yuanxing first year, twelfth month, Xinwei night: Ascended the imperial throne, at the time born more than one hundred days.
translations.idiomatic: On the night of the Xinwei day in the twelfth month of the first year of Yuanxing, he ascended the imperial throne, at the time being more than one hundred days old.

sentences.zh: 尊皇后曰皇太后，太后臨朝。

translations.literal: Honored the Empress as Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager held court.
translations.idiomatic: The Empress was honored as Empress Dowager, and the Empress Dowager held court.

sentences.zh: 北匈奴遣使稱臣，詣敦煌奉獻。

translations.literal: Northern Xiongnu sent envoys to declare themselves subjects, went to Dunhuang to present tribute.
translations.idiomatic: The Northern Xiongnu sent envoys to declare themselves subjects and went to Dunhuang to present tribute.

sentences.zh: 延平元年春正月辛卯，太尉張禹為太傅，司徒徐防為太尉，參錄尚書事，百官總己以聽。

translations.literal: Yanping first year, spring, first month, Xinmao day: Grand Marshal Zhang Yu became Grand Tutor, Minister of the Masses Xu Fang became Grand Marshal, participated in recording Secretariat affairs, all officials took orders from him.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the first month of spring in the first year of Yanping, Grand Marshal Zhang Yu was appointed Grand Tutor; Minister of the Masses Xu Fang was appointed Grand Marshal and participated in recording Secretariat affairs; all officials took orders from him.

sentences.zh: 封皇兄勝為平原王。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed imperial brother Sheng as King of Pingyuan.
translations.idiomatic: Imperial brother Sheng was enfeoffed as King of Pingyuan.

sentences.zh: 癸卯，光祿勳梁鮪為司徒。

translations.literal: Guiyou day: Guanglu Xun Liang Wei became Minister of the Masses.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day, Liang Wei, the Guanglu Xun, became Minister of the Masses.

sentences.zh: 三月甲申，葬孝和皇帝於慎陵，尊廟曰穆宗。

translations.literal: Third month, Jiashen day: Buried Emperor Xiaohe in Shenling, honored his temple as Muzong.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiashen day of the third month, Emperor Xiaohe was buried in Shenling, and his temple was honored as Muzong.

sentences.zh: 丙戌，清河王慶、濟北王壽、河間王開、常山王章始就國。

translations.literal: Bingxu day: King Qing of Qinghe, King Shou of Jibei, King Kai of Hejian, King Zhang of Changshan first took up residence in their kingdoms.
translations.idiomatic: On the Bingxu day, King Qing of Qinghe, King Shou of Jibei, King Kai of Hejian, and King Zhang of Changshan first took up residence in their respective kingdoms.

sentences.zh: 五月辛卯，皇太后詔曰：『皇帝幼沖，承統鴻業，朕且權佐助聽政，兢兢寅畏，不知所濟。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Xinmao day: Empress Dowager edict said: 'The Emperor is young and tender, inherits the great enterprise, I for now temporarily assist and help with governing, reverently and cautiously fearful, know not what to do for relief.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinmao day of the fifth month, the Empress Dowager issued an edict stating: 'The Emperor is young and inexperienced, inheriting this great imperial enterprise; I shall temporarily assist and help with governing, reverently and cautiously fearful, knowing not how to provide relief.'

sentences.zh: 深惟至治之本，道化在前，刑罰在後。

translations.literal: Deeply considering the foundation of supreme governance, moral transformation comes first, punishments come after.
translations.idiomatic: Deeply considering the foundation of supreme governance: moral transformation must come first, punishments afterward.

sentences.zh: 將稽中和，廣施慶惠，與吏民更始。

translations.literal: Will examine the balanced harmony, widely bestow felicitous favors, renew with officials and people.
translations.idiomatic: I shall examine balanced harmony, widely bestow felicitous favors, and make a fresh start with officials and the people.

sentences.zh: 其大赦天下。

translations.literal: Let there be a great amnesty throughout the realm.
translations.idiomatic: Let there be a general amnesty throughout the empire.

sentences.zh: 自建武以來諸犯禁錮，詔書雖解，有司持重，多不奉行，其皆復為平民。』

translations.literal: From the Jianwu period onward, all those imprisoned for violating prohibitions, although edicts have released them, the officials are cautious, many do not carry them out, let them all become commoners again.''
translations.idiomatic: From the Jianwu era onward, all those imprisoned for violating prohibitions—although edicts have released them, the officials have been cautious and many have not carried them out—let them all become commoners again.''

sentences.zh: 壬辰，河東垣山崩。

translations.literal: Rencheng day: Hedong Yuan Mountain collapsed.
translations.idiomatic: On the Rencheng day, Yuan Mountain in Hedong collapsed.

sentences.zh: 六月丁未，太常尹勤為司空。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Dingwei day: Grand Herald Yin Qin became Minister of Works.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingwei day of the sixth month, Yin Qin, the Grand Herald, became Minister of Works.

sentences.zh: 郡國三十七雨水。

translations.literal: Thirty-seven commanderies and kingdoms experienced flooding.
translations.idiomatic: Thirty-seven commanderies and kingdoms suffered from flooding.

sentences.zh: 己未，詔曰：『自夏以來，陰雨過節，煗氣不效，將有厥咎。

translations.literal: Jiwei day: Imperial edict said: 'From summer onward, the yin rains have exceeded proper measure, the warming qi has not taken effect, there will be fault for this.
translations.idiomatic: On the Jiwei day, an imperial edict stated: 'Since summer, the yin rains have exceeded proper bounds, the warming energies have not taken effect; there will be blame for this.'

sentences.zh: 寤寐憂惶，未知所由。

translations.literal: Awake and asleep filled with worry and fear, know not the cause.
translations.idiomatic: I am constantly filled with worry and fear, awake and asleep, knowing not the cause.

sentences.zh: 昔夏后惡衣服，菲飲食，孔子曰「吾無閒然」。

translations.literal: Formerly the Xia ruler disliked fine clothing, ate plain food, Confucius said 'I have no criticism of this.'
translations.idiomatic: In the past, the ruler of Xia disliked fine clothing and ate plain food; Confucius said, 'I have no criticism of this.'

sentences.zh: 今新遭大憂，且歲節未和，徹膳損服，庶有補焉。

translations.literal: Now newly suffering great sorrow, and the year's seasons are not harmonious, withdraw from feasts and reduce clothing, perhaps this will provide some remedy.
translations.idiomatic: Now newly suffering great sorrow, with the year's seasons not yet harmonious, I shall withdraw from feasts and reduce my clothing; perhaps this will provide some remedy.

sentences.zh: 其減太官、導官、尚方、內署諸服御珍膳靡麗難成之物。』

translations.literal: Let the Grand Provisioner, Guide Office, Imperial Workshops, and inner offices reduce all luxurious and difficult-to-make items of clothing, service, precious foods.''
translations.idiomatic: Let the Grand Provisioner, Guide Office, Imperial Workshops, and inner offices reduce all luxurious and difficult-to-make items of clothing, service, and precious foods.''

sentences.zh: 丁卯，詔司徒、大司農、長樂少府曰：『朕以無德，佐助統政，夙夜經營，懼失厥衷。

translations.literal: Dingmao day: Imperial edict to the Minister of the Masses, Grand Minister of Agriculture, Chamberlain for the Palace Revenues said: 'I with my lack of virtue assist and help govern the realm, early and late laboring, fear losing the proper balance.
translations.idiomatic: On the Dingmao day, an imperial edict to the Minister of the Masses, Grand Minister of Agriculture, and Chamberlain for the Palace Revenues stated: 'I, lacking virtue, assist and help govern the realm, laboring early and late, fearing to lose the proper balance.'

sentences.zh: 思惟治道，由近及遠，先內後外。

translations.literal: Considering the way of governance, from near to far, first inner then outer.
translations.idiomatic: Considering the way of governance: from near to far, first inner affairs then outer.

sentences.zh: 自建武之初以至于今，八十餘年，宮人歲增，房御彌廣。

translations.literal: From the beginning of Jianwu onward until now, more than eighty years, palace women increase yearly, the chambers and attendants become increasingly numerous.
translations.idiomatic: From the beginning of the Jianwu era until now, more than eighty years have passed; palace women increase yearly, and the chambers and attendants have become increasingly numerous.

sentences.zh: 又宗室坐事沒入者，猶托名公族，甚可愍焉。

translations.literal: Moreover imperial clansmen who for crimes were confiscated into servitude, still falsely claim the name of imperial clan, this is very pitiable.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, imperial clansmen who were confiscated into servitude due to crimes still falsely claim the name of imperial clan; this is very pitiable.

sentences.zh: 今悉免遣，及掖庭宮人，皆為庶民，以抒幽隔鬱滯之情。

translations.literal: Now all release and send away, and the palace women of the Yeting, all become commoners, to relieve the feelings of secluded isolation and pent-up stagnation.
translations.idiomatic: Now all shall be released and sent away, including the palace women of the Yeting; they shall all become commoners, to relieve feelings of secluded isolation and pent-up stagnation.

sentences.zh: 諸官府、郡國、王侯家奴婢姓劉及疲癃羸老，皆上其名，務令實悉。』

translations.literal: All officials, commanderies, kingdoms, and noble houses' slave servants surnamed Liu and those who are ill and elderly, all submit their names, ensure they are completely accurate.''
translations.idiomatic: All officials, commanderies, kingdoms, and noble houses shall submit the names of their slave servants surnamed Liu and those who are ill and elderly; ensure they are completely accurate.''

sentences.zh: 秋七月庚寅，勑司隸校尉、部刺史曰：『夫天降災戾，應政而至。

translations.literal: Autumn, seventh month, Gengyin day: Instructed the Metropolitan Commandant and the provincial inspectors saying: 'Heaven sends down calamities, they come in response to governance.
translations.idiomatic: On the Gengyin day of the seventh month of autumn, the Metropolitan Commandant and provincial inspectors were instructed: 'Heaven sends down calamities; they come in response to governance.'

sentences.zh: 間者郡國或有水灾，妨害秋稼。

translations.literal: Recently some commanderies and kingdoms have had flooding disasters, harming the autumn harvest.
translations.idiomatic: Recently, some commanderies and kingdoms have suffered flooding disasters that harmed the autumn harvest.

sentences.zh: 朝廷惟咎，憂惶悼懼。

translations.literal: The court takes blame, worried and fearful in sorrow.
translations.idiomatic: The court takes blame for this, filled with worried sorrow and fear.

sentences.zh: 而郡國欲獲豐穰虛飾之譽，遂覆蔽灾害，多張墾田，不揣流亡，競增戶口，掩匿盜賊，令姦惡無懲，署用非次，選舉乖宜，貪苛慘毒，延及平民。

translations.literal: Yet the commanderies and kingdoms desiring empty reputation for bountiful harvests, then conceal disasters, exaggerate cultivated fields, do not assess displaced people, compete to increase household numbers, conceal bandits and thieves, causing evil to go unpunished, appointing out of order, selecting improperly, greedy and harsh to cruelty, extending to the common people.
translations.idiomatic: Yet the commanderies and kingdoms, desiring empty reputations for bountiful harvests, conceal disasters; they exaggerate cultivated fields without assessing displaced people; they compete to inflate household numbers; they conceal bandits and thieves, allowing evil to go unpunished; they appoint officials out of order and select improperly; they are greedy, harsh, and cruel, extending this to the common people.

sentences.zh: 刺史垂頭塞耳，阿私下比，「不畏於天，不愧於人」。

translations.literal: The inspectors hang their heads and stop their ears, curry favor privately with subordinates, 'not fearing Heaven, not ashamed before people.'
translations.idiomatic: The inspectors hang their heads and stop their ears; they curry favor privately with subordinates: 'not fearing Heaven, not ashamed before people.'

sentences.zh: 假貸之恩，不可數恃，自今以後，將糾其罰。

translations.literal: The favor of loans and advances cannot be relied upon repeatedly, from now onward, will correct and punish them.
translations.idiomatic: The favor of loans and advances cannot be relied upon repeatedly; from now onward, they shall be corrected and punished.

sentences.zh: 二千石長吏其各實覈所傷害，為除田租，芻稾。』

translations.literal: The senior officials of two thousand shi rank shall each truly investigate the harm suffered, exempt them from land taxes, fodder.''
translations.idiomatic: The senior officials of two thousand shi rank shall each truly investigate the harm suffered and exempt them from land taxes and fodder.''

sentences.zh: 八月辛亥，帝崩。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Xinhai day: The Emperor passed away.
translations.idiomatic: On the Xinhai day of the eighth month, the Emperor passed away.

sentences.zh: 癸丑，殯於崇德前殿。

translations.literal: Guiyou day: Laid in state in the Chongde Front Hall.
translations.idiomatic: On the Guiyou day, he was laid in state in the Chongde Front Hall.

sentences.zh: 年二歲。

translations.literal: Aged two years.
translations.idiomatic: He was two years old.

sentences.zh: 贊曰：『孝和沈烈，率由前則。

translations.literal: Praise says: 'Xiaohe was profound and fierce, followed by previous examples.
translations.idiomatic: In praise: 'Emperor Xiaohe was profound and fierce, following previous examples.'

sentences.zh: 王赫自中，賜命彊慝。

translations.literal: The King's brilliance from the center, bestowed mandate on the strong and evil.
translations.idiomatic: The King's brilliance emanated from the center, bestowing the mandate on the strong and evil.

sentences.zh: 抑沒祥符，登顯時德。

translations.literal: Suppressed and hidden auspicious omens, elevated and displayed timely virtue.
translations.idiomatic: He suppressed and hid auspicious omens, elevated and displayed timely virtue.

sentences.zh: 殤世何早，平原弗克。』

translations.literal: Shang's world how early, Pingyuan not attained.''
translations.idiomatic: The Shang era ended so early, Pingyuan was not attained.''
